courses.prerequisites: POLI 101 and one of POLI 301, POLI 302, POLI 303, POLI 304, POLI 305, POLI 306, POLI 307, POLI 308.

courses.name: KIN 530B Directed Studies - DIRECTED STUDIES
courses.description: Topics selected by the student, with the approval of the Graduate Advisor, can be studied under the supervision of a member of the faculty.

courses.name: ARCH 411 Materials and Methods of Construction
courses.description: An investigation of building materials and systems considering design objectives, environmental conditions, historical context, regulatory controls, and economic constraints. The major building systems of light wood frame, steel, and concrete and the technical and expressive opportunities inherent in each.  Restricted to B.En.D. students.

courses.name: PHAR 404 Peer Teaching in Pharmacy Skills II
courses.description: Development and delivery of patient counselling role-playing activities in PHAR 303.

courses.name: MEDD 419 Foundations of Scholarship and Flexible Enhanced Learning I
courses.description: Various medically-related learning experiences and scholarly activities. Emphasizes social accountability, introduces scholarly methods, and fosters innovation, creativity, and critical thought to prepare graduates for roles as scholars, life-long learners, and leaders. Pass/fail.

courses.name: CRWR 505M Advanced Writing of Creative Non-Fiction I - ADV CRTV N-FIC I
ECON 326 Methods of Empirical Research in Economics
courses.description: Techniques of empirical economic research. Topics include simple and multiple regression, time series analysis, and simultaneous equation estimation. Students will be required to undertake applied work. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: http://www.calendar.ubc.ca/vancouver/index.cfm?tree=12,215,410,414.

courses.name: COMM 437 Database Technology
courses.description: Theory and technology of database management from an applications perspective; database design; database administration. Credit will not be granted for both COMM 437 and CPSC 304.

courses.name: MECH 463 Mechanical Vibrations
courses.description: Theory of vibration of mechanical systems. Undamped 1 degree of freedom vibration, forced vibrations and resonance, damping, multiple degree of freedom systems, mode shapes and orthogonality, continuous systems, vibration measuring instruments and frequency spectrum analysis.

courses.name: CRWR 230 Introduction to Writing for Comedic Forms
courses.description: An examination of and practice in creative writing in comedic forms, including stand-up, sketch, film, new media, and text. Manuscript submission not required for admission.

courses.name: BIOL 458 Developmental Neurobiology
courses.description: Cellular, molecular and physiological aspects of nervous system development with applications to understanding adult nervous system function and neurological disorders.

courses.name: HEBR 102 Elementary Biblical Hebrew Part II
courses.description: A continuation of HEBR 101: Introduction to Biblical Hebrew grammar. Includes translation of prose and poetry from the Hebrew Bible.

courses.name: PUNJ 100 Introductory Punjabi I
courses.description: Spoken and written Punjabi. Credit will be granted for only one of PUNJ 100 or PUNJ 102. Students who have taken Punjabi 11 in high school cannot take PUNJ 100 for credit.

courses.name: LAW 447B Topics in Commercial Law - TPCS COMCL LAW
courses.description: Not offered each year, consult Faculty.

courses.name: CIVL 210 Soil Mechanics I
courses.description: Soil classification, principle of effective stress, analysis of seepage, filter criteria, introduction to shear strength and slope stability analysis.
courses.corequisites: EOSC 210 and one of CIVL 215, MECH 280, EOSC 329.

courses.name: FRST 526C Directed Studies in Forests and Society - DIR STDY FORESTS
LLED 452 Literacy in the Content Areas: Intermediate Through Secondary
PHYS 403 Statistical Mechanics
courses.description: Principles and applications of  statistical mechanics. Ideal gases, degenerate Fermi gases, Bose-Einstein condensation, black body radiation, fluctuations and phase transitions. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: www.students.ubc.ca/calendar/index.cfm?tree=12,215,410,414.
courses.prerequisites: One of PHYS 203, ENPH 257, PHYS 257, CHEM 201 and one of PHYS 304, PHYS 450, CHEM 312. (One of MATH 318, STAT 241, STAT 251 is recommended.)

courses.name: ASIA 340 History of Later Imperial China
courses.description: History of China from the end of Tang to the eve of its modern transformation.  Students will acquire the analytical skills and tools to understand the political, socio-economic, and cultural changes in imperial China.

courses.name: SPPH 302 Topics in Health Informatics for Health/Life Sciences Students
courses.description: Interprofessional Health and Human Service (IHHS) course. Credit will be granted for only one of SPPH 302 or IHHS 302.

courses.name: ARCH 555 Co-op Work Placement 1
courses.description: Approved and supervised work experience for a minimum of 4 months. Technical report required. Restricted to students admitted to the Architecture Co-op Education Program.

courses.name: ASTU 211 Global Citizenship, Part 2: Community Service Learning and Capstone Conference
RMES 500T Resource and Environmental Workshop - GLBL FOOD SECUR
courses.description: Faculty and students from different disciplines act as an interdisciplinary team studying specific resource problems with ecological, economic, demographic and social dimensions. Techniques and methods are emphasized to show their value in integrating knowledge, defining policy and facilitating communication. Several sections with different emphasis offered each year.

courses.name: MICB 302 Immunology
courses.description: Cells, molecules, and mechanisms of innate and adaptive immunity. Antigen presenting cells and the major histocompatibility complex, T and B lymphocytes and their antigen receptors, T and B cell development, innate and adaptive immune responses against pathogens, diseases associated with aberrant immune responses.

courses.name: SOCI 260A Technology, Work and Society - TECHNOLOGY
courses.description: The social forces responsible for changing patterns of technological innovation and work organization in modern industrial societies. Emphasis on the organization of work and the labour force. Topics may include division of labour, professionalization, labour movements, management techniques and bureaucracy, the social context of research and development initiatives, the effects of new technologies (e.g., automation) on the work place and social aspects of technological development in the Third World.

courses.name: PORT 202 Second-Year Portuguese II
courses.description: Grammar, composition, translation, oral practice, readings. Credit may be granted for only one of PORT 202 or PORT 210.

courses.name: COMM 280 Entrepreneurship
courses.description: Entrepreneurial essentials from creating viable opportunities through building a founding team, strategic planning, going to market, fleshing out an organization and planning the future of the business.

courses.name: BAAC 510 Cost Analysis for Decision Making
DENT 518 Pediatric Dentistry Case Review and Treatment Planning III
CIVL 516 Behaviour of Timber Structures
courses.description: Behaviour of timber structural elements using limit states design principles; joints and fasteners, sawn lumber and engineered wood products, light frame systems and shear walls.

courses.name: ECON 351 Women in the Economy
courses.description: Economic analysis of markets and policies particularly affecting women. Selected topics drawn from economic discrimination; educational, occupational, and work choices; pay and employment equity; allocation of work time and consumption within the household and in the market; economics of marriage and fertility; poverty; taxation; income security and pension policies; and historical perspectives.

courses.name: COMM 311 Research Theory for Commerce Scholars
courses.description: Social science research: theory, research design, methods, and criticism. For students in the Commerce Scholars Program only.

courses.name: MUSC 521B Seminar in Performance Practices - IMGNING MUS PERF
courses.description: Studies in the theoretical and practical problems of musical interpretation.

courses.name: ASIA 347 Traditional Korean Literature in Translation
courses.description: An introduction to Korean literature from ancient times to 1900.

courses.name: SPAN 404A Topics in Hispanic Cinema - TPCS HISP CINEMA
courses.prerequisites: One of SPAN 220, SPAN 221 and SPAN 302.

courses.name: THTR 299C Production I - PRODUCTION I
courses.description: Assigned projects in theatre production.

courses.name: CAPS 423 Mammalian Renal and Gastrointestinal Physiology
courses.description: Control of mammalian renal and gastrointestinal systems. Role in homeostasis. Intended for Honours students in Cellular, Anatomical and Physiological Sciences or other life sciences.
courses.prerequisites: (A cumulative average of 75% over at least 90 credits attempted in the first three years of a student's program and a minimum mark of 75% in CAPS 301 or PHYL 301. Permission of the course director is also required.)

courses.name: LIBR 521 Contemporary Literature and Other Materials for Children
GERM 304 German Cinema (in English)
courses.description: Screening, discussion, and critical analysis of German cinema from the silent era to the 21st century.

courses.name: ASTR 407 Planetary Science
courses.description: Structure of planetary systems, planetary interiors, planet formation, planetary atmospheres, meteoritics, impact cratering.
courses.prerequisites: One of PHYS 210, EOSC 211 and one of MATH 217, MATH 227, MATH 317 and one of MATH 316, PHYS 312 and one of ASTR 200, EOSC 212.
courses.corequisites: One of PHYS 206, PHYS 216, PHYS 306, EOSC 352.

courses.name: SPPH 502 Epidemiological Methods 1
courses.description: Sources and uses of epidemiologic data for health services planning and administration including methods of data collection and study design.
courses.prerequisites: (Enrolment in a Health Care and Epidemiology graduate program, or permission of instructor.)

courses.name: MECH 502 Fluid Mechanics
courses.description: Governing equations; viscous incompressible flow, incompressible potential flow; incompressible boundary layers, stability and turbulence; compressible potential flow.

courses.name: CPSC 404 Advanced Relational Databases
courses.description: Physical database design, indexing, relational query processing and optimization, transaction processing, concurrency control, crash recovery, data warehouses, data cubes, views, special topics.
courses.prerequisites: CPSC 304 and one of CPSC 213, CPSC 261.

courses.name: WOOD 440 Engineering Economics
courses.description: Use of engineering economics to evaluate investment proposals of an engineering nature, including decision making processes, time value of money, cash flow analysis, comparison methods, depreciation, replacement analysis, taxes, inflation and sensitivity analysis.

courses.name: EPSE 310A Assessment and Learning in the Classroom - ASMNT&LRN IN CLS
courses.description: Pass/Fail.

courses.name: RMES 507 Human Technological Systems
courses.description: Critical analysis of harms and benefits, and anticipation of global technological innovations, as they interact with social behaviour.

courses.name: ELEC 499A Undergraduate Thesis - UNDERGRAD THESIS
courses.description: Project in electrical engineering or computer engineering involving design, experimental and/or computer simulation work as selected from topics supplied by faculty members. An individual project thesis is to be prepared according to specifications available from the departmental office.

courses.name: GPP 501 Microeconomic Analysis for Public Policy
courses.description: Basics of supply and demand; fundamentals of decision making by consumers, households and firms; market structure and sources of market failure that necessitate policy interventions.

courses.name: SPPH 581L Selected Topics - CHILD HLTH DVLP
courses.description: By seminar and directed readings, certain topics of current interest are explored in depth.

courses.name: CHBE 484 Green Engineering Principles and Applications for Process Industries
courses.description: Pollution prevention, cleaner production, green chemistry and engineering, industrial ecology, eco-industrial parks, and sustainable development; environmental impact assessment including life-cycle assessment, total cost analysis and environmental systems analysis; reduce/recycling/reuse of wastes and by-products.

courses.name: BIOL 325 Introduction to Animal Mechanics and Locomotion
courses.description: Comparative aspects of the functional design of skeletal systems and the mechanics of swimming, flying and terrestrial locomotion, with particular reference to the vertebrates.

courses.name: LAW 422 Intellectual Property
courses.description: Copyright, patents, trade marks, industrial design, the protection of computer software, and torts such as passing-off and breach of confidence.

courses.name: BUSI 465 Marketing Management
courses.description: Basic considerations affecting the domestic and international marketing of goods and services.

courses.name: PHIL 561A Topics in Science and Technology Studies - TOPICS IN STS
courses.description: Advanced seminar on a theme or topic of interest to both STS and Philosophy.

courses.name: GERM 313 Conversational German II
courses.description: Emphasis on the study of oral communication skills and strategies. Fluency in many situations, communicative competence in important areas of cultural life, ability to participate in discussions of current as well as controversial issues to express ideas clearly in spoken word.

courses.name: CRWR 308A Intermediate Writing for Graphic Forms - INTRMD GRAPHIC
courses.description: The writing of graphica (comics, manga and graphic novels), using a combination of workshopping and online modules. Manuscript submission not required for admission.

courses.name: ATSC 404 Dynamic Meteorology
courses.description: Dynamic principles governing atmospheric motions on a rotating planet. Simplified mathematical models of atmospheric flow based on scale analysis. Application to synoptic-scale and general circulation of the troposphere.
courses.prerequisites: One of PHYS 312, MATH 316 and one of EOSC 250, MATH 217, MATH 317.

courses.name: BIOL 430 Genome Evolution
courses.description: Application of genetics and molecular biology to evolutionary problems. Emphasis on using macromolecular sequence information to answer questions about phylogeny and population structure, and on the evolutionary implications of recent discoveries in molecular genetics.

courses.name: FNH 497A Directed Studies in Food, Nutrition and Health - DST FOOD,NTR HLT
FNH 313 Microorganisms in Food Systems
courses.description: Microorganisms of importance in safety, spoilage and preservation of foods; factors affecting growth, survival and inactivation of microorganisms in fermented food systems; food processing plant cleaning and sanitation.

courses.name: APSC 172 Engineering Analysis I
courses.description: Functions, limits, differentiation, applications of derivatives, integration, applications of definite integrals.

courses.name: MINE 333 Flotation
courses.description: Theory and technology of flotation and ancillary processes.

courses.name: MTRL 467 Engineering Project II
courses.description: Design projects to illustrate the full spectrum of design encountered in Metals and Materials Engineering including the design of components, structures and processes used to manufacture materials.

courses.name: BIOL 310 Introduction to Animal Behaviour
courses.description: Animal behavior from an ecological and evolutionary perspective; the methods used to study behaviour and test its adaptive significance.

courses.name: MATH 620E Directed Studies in Mathematics - DIRECT STDS MATH
courses.description: Advanced study under the direction of a faculty member may be arranged in special situations.

courses.name: MECH 522 Foundations in Control Engineering
courses.description: State space model; stability; controlability; observability; Kalman decomposition; state feedback; oberver; linear quadratic regulator; Kalman filter. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH 468 or 522.

courses.name: ARST 596 Professional Experience
courses.description: Project-based experience undertaken with a faculty associate occupying a minimum of ten hours a week for 12 consecutive weeks or the equivalent time. Evaluation: Pass/Fail.
courses.prerequisites: (24 credits in the program are required.)

courses.name: LAW 421C Topics in Labour Law - TPCS LABOUR LAW
courses.description: Not offered each year, consult Faculty.

courses.name: BUSI 441 Real Estate Management I
courses.description: Examines the day-to-day issues which affect the practice of property management.

courses.name: FRST 200 Forest Plant Biology I
courses.description: The structure, diversity and development of trees and other plants, with emphasis on the angiosperms.

courses.name: SOWK 505 Social Analysis for Social Work Practice
ASIA 457 The Modern Korean Novel
courses.description: Survey of major single-volume novels, ranging from Yi Kwang-su's Heartlessness to Ch'oe Yun's There a Petal Silently Falls, in translation.
courses.prerequisites: ASIA 357. (Permission of instructor is also acceptable.)

courses.name: FREN 511D Studies in Contemporary French Literature - CONTEMP FR LIT
CHIN 411 Introductory Modern Chinese Literature I (Non-Heritage)
courses.description: A reading-intensive introduction to modern Chinese literature from 1900 to 1949, with a focus on fiction.
courses.prerequisites: One of CHIN 303, CHIN 304 and one of CHIN 307, CHIN 308.

courses.name: DENT 505 Dental Traumatology
courses.description: Dental trauma and tooth resorptions: etiology, pathogenesis, epidemiology, diagnosis, and treatment. Lectures, seminars, and simulation training.

courses.name: PHYS 534 Radiotherapy Physics I
courses.description: Principles of dosimetry of ionizing radiation with emphasis on applications to radiotherapy and radiobiology.

courses.name: MUSC 156C Vocal Chamber Ensembles - CHAMBER CHOIR
courses.description: May be repeated for credit in accordance with program requirements for B.Mus. or B.A. in Music. Open to other students by audition, with credit, as stipulated by their faculties.

courses.name: MUSC 200 Chromatic Harmony and Voice Leading
courses.description: Harmonic and linear functions of common chromatic chords; mixture; chords and progressions of linear origin; tonal plans. Compositional and analytical exercises.

courses.name: PCTH 449C Honours Thesis - HONOURS THESIS
courses.description: A research problem directed by a faculty member. Restricted to Honours Pharmacology students.

courses.name: FNEL 121 Introduction to a  Dene (Athapaskan) Language I
courses.description: Emphasis on accurate pronunciation, conversation, basic grammatical structures and listening and literacy skills, and the study of oral traditions in their cultural context. No prior knowledge of the language is assumed. Not offered every year.

courses.name: BUSI 344 Statistical and Computer Applications in Valuation
courses.description: Explores creative, practical uses of statistical and computer applications in determining and analyzing real estate value. Through case studies and hands-on computer work, students will learn the fundamentals of exploratory data analysis and appraisal valuation modeling.

courses.name: LAW 451 Trusts
courses.description: History and nature of trusts; express, resulting, implied and constructive trusts; charitable and purpose trusts; administration of trusts; breach of trust. Credit will be granted for only one of LAW 250 or LAW 451.

courses.name: GERM 303 German Literature Before 1900 (in English)
courses.description: Reading and discussion of translated works from the German-speaking countries from the Middle Ages to 1900.

courses.name: SPAN 495 Research Intensive Seminar in Spanish Literature and Culture
FIPR 437 Cinematography II
courses.description: Advanced camera operation, lighting, and shot design. Open only to students in the FILM BFA Program.

courses.name: FIST 300 Cult Cinema
courses.description: Overview of world cult cinema.

courses.name: NURS 344 Nursing Synthesis Project
courses.description: Self-directed student project to synthesize and apply knowledge in a field of nursing practice under the guidance of a faculty mentor. Pass/Fail.
courses.prerequisites: All of NURS 302, NURS 303, NURS 304, NURS 305, NURS 306, NURS 338, NURS 339, NURS 340.

courses.name: MINE 509 Mine Ventilation
courses.description: Mine air conditioning, ventilation network analysis, radioactivity in mining, case studies in mine ventilation and control of dust, fumes and diesel exhausts. Credit will be granted for only one of MINE 509 or MINE 560.

courses.name: MATH 613D Topics in Number Theory - NUMBER THEORY
POLI 334 Comparative Democratization
courses.description: Literatures and theories on regime democratization around the world; the roles of political, economic, social, and international factors in encouraging or impeding democratization.

courses.name: EPSE 320 Classroom Inclusion of Students who are Blind and Visually Impaired
courses.description: Inclusion issues of students with visual impairments in general education classrooms; information about visual impairment, classroom adaptations and accommodations, and application of Universal Design. Appropriate for education majors and classroom teachers.

courses.name: MECH 488 Introduction to Ship Hydrodynamics
courses.description: Ship terminology, lines plans, ship hydrostatics, transverse and longitudinal stability of ships, dimensional analysis, ship resistance prediction; ship propulsion methods, propeller selection and design.
courses.prerequisites: One of MECH 380, CIVL 315. (or permission of instructor.)

courses.name: GRSJ 503D Special Topics in Feminist Studies - TPC FEMNST STDYS
ASIA 386 Chinese Grammar and Usage I
courses.description: In-depth examination of modern Chinese grammar and its usage including word formation, syntactic constructions, discourse cohesions, semantics, and stylistic considerations.
courses.prerequisites: Either (a) all of CHIN 207, CHIN 208 or (b) all of CHIN 217, CHIN 218. (or higher level of Chinese language proficiency.)

courses.name: EDCP 598A Field Experiences - FIELD EXPERIENCE
courses.description: Field experiences in community-based or museum contexts. Focus on curriculum design and evaluation.

courses.name: SPPH 542 Canadian Health Policy
courses.description: Analysis of the evolution and structure of the Canadian health care system.

courses.name: MECH 421 Mechatronics System Instrumentation
courses.description: Architecture of mechatronics devices; integration of mechanical, electronics, sensors, actuators, computer and real time software systems; PLC and PC based systems; discrete and continuous automation system design.

courses.name: MICB 308 Paradigms in Bacterial Pathogenesis
courses.description: Mechanisms of bacterial pathogenesis including adherence, invasion, intracellular survival, toxins, host defenses and microbial evasion strategies, antibiotics, and vaccines.  Introduction to experimental approaches used to study bacterial pathogens.
courses.prerequisites: Either (a) all of BIOL 201, MICB 202 or (b) BIOT 380.

courses.name: MINE 590P Special Advanced Topics - ADV TECH MINERAL
courses.description: A special advanced course may be arranged upon the approval of the department head.

courses.name: PHAR 450B Selected Topics - SELECTED TOPICS
courses.description: Thesis or Essay.

courses.name: ASIA 314 Premodern Japan
courses.description: Japanese history (political, economic, social and cultural) to 1600.

courses.name: HIST 376 Modern Japanese History Since 1800
courses.description: The building of a modern state, its crisis in the 1930s, and its postwar recovery; topics include business institutions, politics, imperialism, intellectual syncretism, social change, and Japan's growing influence in the world.

courses.name: LLED 200 Introduction to Writing in Academic and Professional Registers
courses.description: Examination of sociolinguistic knowledge and skills that are central to the production of academic and professional texts.

courses.name: SOCI 470A Sociology of Crime and Justice - CRIME & JUSTICE
courses.description: Critical examination of specific forms of crime and delinquency in relation to the criminal justice system including law, enforcement, and corrections. Issues selected for study will be further scrutinized within the cultural framework of ethics, morality, and social justice.

courses.name: FIST 332 Studies in Genre or Period
courses.description: A seminar examining one or more genres or periods, such as the Western, Film Noir, Science Fiction, Films of the 1980's. Also includes study of national cinemas.

courses.name: LIBE 580C Problems in Education - PROB IN EDUC
courses.description: Investigation and report of a problem.

courses.name: COMM 486Q Special Topics in Business - ADV TPC CORP FIN
SOWK 516 Foundation MSW Integrative Seminar
courses.description: Development of professional judgment, critical reflection, and integration of theory, practice, research and policy.

courses.name: ASIA 456 History and Culture of Taiwan
courses.description: The major social, economic, political, and cultural changes in Taiwan since the seventeenth century; the post-World War II process of democratization and Taiwan?s place in the contemporary world.

courses.name: DENT 504 Endodontic Microsurgery
courses.description: Treatment planning, instruments, techniques, materials, prognosis, and evaluation of results. Lectures, seminars, and simulation training.

courses.name: MATH 323 Introduction to Rings and Modules
courses.description: Rings, ideals, unique factorization, Euclidean rings, fields, polynomial rings, modules; structure theory of modules over a principal ideal domain.

courses.name: EOSC 532 Field Laboratory in Groundwater Hydrology
courses.description: Hydraulic head measurements, water-quality sampling, pump and slug testing, infiltration measurements, profiling techniques. Computer analysis of field data. Held after spring term at the Richmond groundwater hydrology field site. Enrolment limitations.

courses.name: GEOB 406 Watershed Geomorphology
courses.description: Hillslope and stream channel processes and their rates of operation. Analysis and modeling geomorphic processes and associated hazards at the watershed scale. Applications in geoscience and engineering.

courses.name: DENT 780 Clinical Pediatric Dentistry I
courses.description: Continues in year 5.

courses.name: PSYC 409 Cognitive Neuropsychology
courses.description: The structure of the mind as revealed by brain injury, neurological illness, and surgical intervention.  Topics include attention, memory, language, sense of self, topographic awareness, moral reasoning, emotion, theory of mind, and social awareness.
courses.prerequisites: Either (a) all of PSYC 217, PSYC 218 or (b) PSYC 366 and one of PSYC 309, PSYC 365.

courses.name: MATH 322 Introduction to Group Theory
courses.description: Groups, cosets, homomorphisms, group actions, p-groups, Sylow theorems, composition series, finitely generated Abelian groups.
courses.prerequisites: Either (a) a score of 68% or higher in one of MATH 223, MATH 310 or (b) one of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223 and a score of 80% or higher in MATH 220.

courses.name: PLAN 548P Current Issues in Planning - INDIG COMM PLAN
courses.description: Each year the school may offer one or more courses on a topical issue covering recent advances in the field.

courses.name: COMM 590A Topics in Business Administration - TOPICS BUS ADMIN
ASIA 377 History of Korean Thought
courses.description: An examination of Korean religious, philosophical, and scientific thought from the earliest written records to the present day, with particular focus on the interaction of Shamanism, Buddhism, Confucianism, and, in the present century, Christianity.

courses.name: PLAN 528A Capstone Professional Report - PROFESSION REPRT
LAW 468 Ethics and Professionalism
courses.description: The ethical dimensions of legal practice in Canada, including legislation, regulations, rules of professional conduct and cases, and the roles of lawyers, the legal profession and the legal system including their role in securing access to justice.

courses.name: GPP 506 Public Management
courses.description: Governmental implementation and delivery of public policy. Variations in international practice, the growing interdependence of governments, firms and non-government organizations. Complexities of multi-level governance including control and accountability of governments.

courses.name: APBI 414 Animals and Global Issues
courses.description: Research seminar integrating diverse information to address global animal issues including: animal-source foods and human health, environmental impact of livestock production, trade in exotic animals.

courses.name: CLST 511A Studies in Greek Regional Archaeology - GREEK REGNL ARCH
courses.description: Study of a particular area, e.g., Ionia, Sicily, Southern Italy.

courses.name: LFS 252 Land, Food, and Community: Quantitative Data Analysis
courses.description: Introduction to tools needed for data analysis of the economic, ecological, health, and scientific components of land and food systems.
courses.prerequisites: One of MATH 100, MATH 102, MATH 104, MATH 110, MATH 120, MATH 180, MATH 184.

courses.name: MECH 380 Fluid Dynamics
courses.description: Review of principles, compressible flow, potential flow, simple laminar viscous flow, boundary layers, flow around bluff bodies.
courses.prerequisites: Either (a) MECH 225 or (b) MATH 255 and one of CHBE 251, CIVL 215, MECH 280 and one of CHBE 241, ENPH 257.

courses.name: FNIS 400 Practicum/Advanced Research Seminar
courses.description: Applied research/community oriented project designed and implemented in collaboration with student, faculty and Aboriginal community organization. Emphasis on examining ethical issues and developing culturally respectful and academically rigorous forms of research. Credit will be granted for only one of FNIS 400 or FNSP 400.
courses.prerequisites: Either (a) all of FNIS 310, FNIS 320 or (b) all of FNSP 310, FNSP 320. (Students must pass FNIS 320 or FNSP 320 with a B- or higher or request program approval.)

courses.name: LAW 300 Jurisprudence and Critical Perspectives
courses.description: Introduction to the basic principles of legal theory and critical perspectives on law. Credit will be granted for only one of LAW 290 or LAW 300.

courses.name: POLI 385A Public Opinion and Elections - PBLC OPN,ELEC
courses.description: Psychological and social foundations of public opinion; quality of democratic decision-making; how voters make up their minds; impact of electoral systems; social bases of party systems; campaigns and the mass media. The Canadian experience in comparative context.

courses.name: HIST 311 The British Empire after 1850
courses.description: Transformation of the British imperial system from the mid-nineteenth century to de-colonization and neo-colonialism after the second World War.

courses.name: MATH 180 Differential Calculus with Physical Applications
courses.description: Topics as for Math 100; intended for students with no previous knowledge of Calculus. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: www.students.ubc.ca/calendar/index.cfm?tree=12,215,410,414. Not for credit for students with AP Calculus AB, AP Calculus BC, or a passing score on the UBC-SFU-UVIC-UNBC Calculus Challenge Examination.
courses.prerequisites: (One of BC Principles of Mathematics 12 or Pre-calculus 12 and one of (a) a grade of 80% or higher in BC Principles of Mathematics 12 or Pre-calculus 12, (b) a satisfactory score in the UBC Mathematics Basic Skills Test.)

courses.name: BIOL 454 Comparative Animal Physiology
courses.description: Selected topics in physiology emphasizing comparisons between diverse phylogenetic groups of animals.

courses.name: PSYC 366 Methods in Research
courses.description: Detailed coverage of basic research methods; the design of experiments and statistical analysis; methods will be applied in laboratory and project work. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List:  www.students.ubc.ca/calendar/index.cfm?tree=12,215,410,414.

courses.name: KIN 500E Special Topics in Kinesiology - SPEC TPCS KIN
MEDG 410 Immunogenetics
courses.description: Molecular basis of lymphocyte development, activation and adhesion; immunogenetics and the major histocompatibility complex. Consult the Credit Exclusion list within the Faculty of Science section of the Calendar.
courses.prerequisites: MICB 302 and one of BIOL 334, BIOL 335. (A standing of "B" or better is recommended.)

courses.name: PHIL 311A The Philosophy of Aristotle - PHILOSOPHY ARIST
courses.description: A study of Aristotle's writings and his influence on subsequent philosophy.

courses.name: BIOL 455 Comparative Neurobiology
courses.description: Current approaches in neurobiology, from the cellular to the behavioural level, are examined using representatives of vertebrate and invertebrate nervous systems.
courses.prerequisites: One of BIOL 361, BIOL 362, BIOL 364, CAPS 301, PSYC 360.

courses.name: CIVL 570 Advanced Soil Mechanics
courses.description: Soil composition and geological factors affecting engineering properties, stress and strain at a point, principle of effective stress, stress-strain relations; theories of primary and secondary consolidation, settlement; shear testing equipment, stress-strain and strength behaviour of soil under static and dynamic loading.

courses.name: FREN 330 Selected Works of Quebecois Literature
courses.description: Representative works viewed in their historical, social, and cultural contexts.

courses.name: BIOL 301 Biomathematics
courses.description: Introduction to uses of mathematics in the biological sciences; experimental design and modelling of biological processes. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion Lists: www.students.ubc.ca/calendar/index.cfm?tree=12,215,410,414.

courses.name: CPSC 420 Advanced Algorithms Design and Analysis
courses.description: The study of advanced topics in the design and analysis of algorithms and associated data structures. Topics include algorithms for graph-theoretic; algebraic and geometric problems; algorithms on nonsequential models; complexity issues; approximation algorithms.

courses.name: BUSI 398 Residental Property Guided Case Study
courses.description: The residential property appraisal process, focusing both on valuation techniques as well as general research and report writing skills.

courses.name: MUSC 122 Class Woodwinds
courses.description: Group instruction in music performance. Restricted to B.Mus. students.

courses.name: LING 448A Directed Studies - DIRECTED STUDIES
courses.description: Supervisor and topic chosen by mutual agreement between student and Linguistics faculty member. Department Advisor approval is required.

courses.name: PHAR 479 Advanced Pharmacy Practice Experience - Community
courses.description: A 320-hour pharmacy clerkship emphasizing integration of knowledge and skills in developing and assessing therapeutic plans for patients in community practice.

courses.name: ANTH 332 Oral Tradition
courses.description: An ethnographic perspective on the dynamics of oral tradition in various oral and literate cultures; the characteristics and roles of oral genres including folktale, genealogy, oral history, autobiography, and myth in these societies; and the relationship between orality and literacy.

courses.name: SOWK 550 Social Work and Social Justice
BIOC 410 Nucleic Acids-Structure and Function
courses.description: Chemical, physical and biological properties of nucleic acids and their role in replication, transcription, translation and regulation of expression of genetic material. Credit will not be given for both BIOC 410 and 510.
courses.prerequisites: Either (a) all of BIOC 303, BIOL 335 or (b) BIOT 380. (A minimum standing of 65% is recommended in these courses.)

courses.name: LAW 380B Externship Reflection - EXTRNSHP REFLECT
courses.description: Structured reflective exercises on the LAW 379 Externship experience.

courses.name: PHYS 312 Introduction to Mathematical Physics
courses.description: The application of ordinary and partial differential equations to physical problems; boundary and initial value problems associated with heat, wave and Laplace equations. Fourier analysis; expansions in Bessel and Legendre functions. Credit will be given for only one of PHYS 312 and MATH 316.

courses.name: CHIN 323 Business Chinese II (Heritage)
courses.description: Continuation of CHIN 321.

courses.name: FRST 239 Tree and Stand Level Measurements
courses.description: An introduction to measurement of individual trees and stands; use of aerial photographs, maps, and various measurement instruments.

courses.name: ANTH 350A Ethnography of the Pacific Islands: Polynesia and Micronesia - ETHNO:POLY/MICRO
courses.description: Major cultural groupings in Polynesia and Micronesia, emphasizing both traditional cultures and the incorporation of the region into modern international institutions.

courses.name: MICB 449 Research Problem
courses.description: A laboratory investigation in the final year of the Honours program. The results are presented in a written report, to be reviewed by oral examination.
courses.prerequisites: Either (a) MICB 323 or (b) all of MICB 322, MICB 399.

courses.name: CLST 312 Women in the Roman World of Republican and Imperial Times
courses.description: Women  in the Roman world in the culture of the Republic and the Empire. Literary, artistic, and mythological sources are compared and contrasted to historical, legal, and archaeological records.

courses.name: SPPH 518 Mathematical Modeling of Communicable Diseases
courses.description: Application of mathematical models in understanding communicable disease dynamics and control; interpretation of model outcomes; modeling methods and their applications.

courses.name: MTRL 451 Microstructural Analysis Laboratory
courses.description: Basic principles and techniques of microstructural analysis with particular reference to engineered materials including x-ray, SEM microprobe TEM and high energy electron analysis.

courses.name: FNH 380 Professional Dietetic Practice I
courses.description: Introduction to the profession of dietetics in Canada. Restricted to students in the Dietetics Major.

courses.name: PHYS 572 Experimental Methods in Quantum Materials
GEOG 329 Introduction to Political Geography
courses.description: The heritage of political geography; the spatial structure of political organization including regional and global structures.
courses.prerequisites: One of GEOG 121, GEOG 122. (or the former GEOG 260; also open without this prerequisite to Major and Honours students in History,  International Relations or Political Science.)

courses.name: ISCI 448E Directed Studies - DIRECTED STUDIES
courses.description: Permission of the Director is required.

courses.name: EDUC 276 Teaching Mathematics II
courses.description: For Dadaab, Kenya teacher education students.

courses.name: THTR 374 Intermediate Voice, Speech, and Movement II
courses.description: Open only to B.F.A. Acting students.

courses.name: PLAN 595 Planning and Negotiation in Natural Resources Management
courses.description: Institutional structures for policy development and implementation.

courses.name: BIOL 448D Directed Studies in Biology - DIRECTED STUDIES
courses.description: A course designed to allow students to undertake an investigation on a specific topic as agreed upon by the faculty member and the student. Permission of the supervisor required. No more than six credits of BIOL 448 may be taken with the same supervisor.

courses.name: COMM 321 Organizational Behaviour
courses.description: Effects of individual and group behaviour on organizational processes and outcomes. Application of relevant frameworks from the social sciences to particular organizational situations.

courses.name: CHEM 499 Co-operative Work Placement IV
courses.description: Approved and supervised technical work experience in an industrial research setting for a minimum of 3.5 months. Taken during the fall term of the fifth year. Technical report required. Restricted to students admitted to the Co-operative Education Program in Chemistry.

courses.name: FIST 331 Studies in Film Theory
courses.description: A seminar introducing the many theoretical approaches to film: formalist, historical, Marxist, psychoanalytic, semiotic, and structuralist.

courses.name: EDCP 601A Doctoral Seminar in Curriculum and Pedagogy: History and Theory - HIST & THRY SEM
RMES 530 Knowledge, Policy and Values in Risk and Resource Management
courses.description: The course focuses on the role of values, science and validity of alternate knowledge systems.  Included in the dialogue are the democratization of science, uncertainty, adaptive scientific practices and the values that govern management programs.

courses.name: PSYC 101 Introduction to Biological and Cognitive Psychology
courses.description: Introduction to Methods and Statistics, Biopsychology, Learning, Perception, Memory, and Cognition. Credit will not be given for both PSYC 100 and PSYC 101.

courses.name: ECON 690C Workshops in Economics - WRKSHOPS IN ECON
LAW 455 Real Estate Transactions
courses.description: The law relating to the sale and purchase of land, real estate agency, and mortgages.

courses.name: VISA 341 Intermediate Photography II
courses.description: An investigation of contemporary photography production and approaches to the constructed image with emphasis on medium and large format camera use and studio lighting techniques.

courses.name: PSYC 309A Cognitive Processes - COGNTV PROCESSES
courses.description: Contribution of cognitive processes to perception, attention, and memory; cognitive development, language, thinking, and creativity.
courses.prerequisites: Either (a) PSYC 100 or (b) all of PSYC 101, PSYC 102. (Or (c) 6 credits of 200-level Psychology (but not 205 or 263).)

courses.name: GEOB 500 Contemporary Research Trends in Physical Geography
FISH 520 Fisheries Conservation, Governance, and Evaluation
EPSE 503 Cultural Perspectives on Learning, Development and Media
RHSC 500 Advanced Concepts for Rehabilitation Research
courses.description: Issues relevant to clinical investigations in rehabilitation. Emphasis on research design, measurement issues, selection of analytical approaches, and relevant epidemiological concepts.

courses.name: PATH 427 Basic Principles of Infection Prevention and Control
courses.description: This course provides the basic principles to prevent the spread of microorganisms pathogenic to humans. It may be taken towards a Certificate in Infection Control.

courses.name: STAT 545A Exploratory Data Analysis - DATA ANALYSIS
WOOD 292 Two-Dimensional and Solid Computer-Aided Graphics
courses.description: Computer-aided graphics software used in the wood products sector.  Visualization of product designs and specifications in two and three dimensions.

courses.name: ANTH 407 Principles of Field Work
courses.description: An examination of field work as the basic setting for ethnographic research. Research design; relationships with study participants, field techniques, and data analysis and presentation.

courses.name: CRWR 309A Intermediate Writing Fiction - INTMD WRT FICTIN
courses.description: An exploration of the writing of fiction, focusing on how a writer employs the technical elements of the craft of fiction. Manuscript submission not required for admission.

courses.name: PHYS 318 Experimental Acoustics
courses.description: Experimental techniques of acoustics: data acquisition hardware and software, microphones, loudspeakers, noise, vibration and modal analysis.

courses.name: SOIL 518 Water in International Development
courses.description: Key water issues associated with international development: global water demand, scarcity, efficiency of use, water as a commodity, biophysical and policy aspects of water management, water and health, land use impact, water harvesting, improved irrigation, and pollution prevention.  Credit will be given for only one of SOIL 518 or RMES 518.

courses.name: BAFI 580A Special Topics in Finance - TPCS FINANCE
EOSC 223 Field Techniques
courses.description: Introduction to the techniques of geological mapping and the interpretation of field data. Includes three one-day field trips on weekends plus a seven-day field school after Spring examinations. A fee is to be paid by January 31.

courses.name: ECED 598C Field Experiences - FIELD EXPERIENCE
courses.description: For those in master's, doctoral, and diploma programs.

courses.name: MTRL 455 Economic Aspects of Materials Engineering
courses.description: Time value of money, cash flows, capital and operating cost estimation, financial decision making and relevant case studies.

courses.name: PHYS 210 Introduction to Computational Physics
courses.description: Introduction to UNIX/Linux; software tools for processing, fitting and displaying data; numerical methods and application in the physical sciences.
courses.prerequisites: One of PHYS 102, PHYS 108, PHYS 118, PHYS 158, PHYS 153, SCIE 001.

courses.name: LING 505A Issues in Morphological Theory and Analysis - MORPH THRY ANLYS
courses.description: Morphology from both historical and theoretical perspectives.

courses.name: RHSC 581B Writing to Enhance Practice - WRITE ENHANCE PR
POLI 320A Government and Politics of the United States of America - GOVRT&POLTCS USA
courses.description: The distinctive political system of the U.S. Covers all major institutions and processes, focusing on contemporary issues. Comparisons with the Canadian system. Sources of political failure and possible reform.

courses.name: DENT 511 Pediatric Dentistry Literature Review II
courses.description: Continues in year 3.

courses.name: GPP 591 Special Topics in Public Policy
MUSC 100 Principles of Musical Form
courses.description: Fundamental materials and processes of music - rhythmic, melodic, textural and harmonic - and how they create small-scale structures in a variety of styles. Compositional and analytical applications.

courses.name: LASO 204 Introduction to Law and Society
courses.description: Ideas, concepts, and frameworks for thinking about the nature of law and legal processes in both Canadian and global contexts.

courses.name: EPSE 565E Special Course in Subject Matter Field - SP CRSE: SUBJ FL
PLAN 547C Professional Project Report - PROF PRJ REPORT
courses.description: Research and preparation of a professional project report on a planning topic in public policy or professional practice.

courses.name: GEOG 321 Historical Geography of Urbanization: Cities, Space, and Power
courses.description: From the origins of urbanism to the modern era.

courses.name: NEST 301 The Ancient Near East
courses.description: A history from 3100-333 BC with emphasis on Mesopotamia.

courses.name: FNH 499 Undergraduate Thesis
courses.description: Design and execution of an experimental/analytical research project leading to preparation of a thesis.
courses.prerequisites: (Approval of a program advisor; consult before the end of classes in third year.)

courses.name: CHIN 203 Intermediate Chinese I: Part 2 (Non-Heritage)
courses.description: Continuation of CHIN 201.

courses.name: PATH 448 Introduction to Laboratory Medicine
courses.description: An elective course open to first-year medical students who spend at least three consecutive hours each week in one of the affiliated hospitals of the Department of Pathology, Vancouver Hospital, under the joint supervision of a Senior Resident in Pathology and the Professional Staff of the following Divisions: anatomical pathology, clinical biochemistry, haematology, paediatric pathology. Enrolment is limited.

courses.name: BIOL 450 Molecular Adaptation of Animals to the Environment
courses.description: Physiological, biochemical, and molecular strategies of adaptation of animals to environmental challenges.  The evolution of genetic and biochemical systems, and their impact on animal structure and function.
courses.prerequisites: One of BIOL 362, BIOL 364 and one of BIOC 300, BIOC 302, BIOC 303. (BIOL 454 is recommended.)

courses.name: MECH 514 Linear FEA in Solids and Heat Transfer
courses.description: Theory and element selection.  Virtual work and weighted residual formulation.  Linear elastic analysis.  Heat transfer analysis.  Isoparametic elements.  Computer program development.  Utilization of existing computer packages.  Credit is given for one of MECH 514 and MECH 462.

courses.name: SOWK 559 Advanced Integrative Seminar
courses.description: Advanced development of professional judgment, critical reflection, and integration of theory, practice, research, policy.

courses.name: COMM 695 Advanced Topics in Empirical Corporate Finance
ARCL 326 Primatology
courses.description: A comprehensive survey of primates, with emphasis on evolution, ecology, social organization,  social behaviour, and field studies.

courses.name: AUDI 580 Speech Perception and Hearing Ability
RUSS 300 Third-Year Russian
courses.description: Intermediate oral practice, syntax and composition.

courses.name: LIBR 514K Topics in the Bibliographic Control of Information - TPCS BBL CTL INF
EDUC 272 Teaching Chemistry
courses.description: For Dadaab, Kenya teacher education students.

courses.name: EDST 509 Constructing Citizens: Canada and the Educational Past
CIVL 596C Project in Civil Engineering - ENERGY COMPARE
courses.description: For M.Eng. students only.

courses.name: LING 209 Clinical Topics in Speech, Language, and Hearing Sciences
courses.description: Introduction to speech and hearing sciences, with emphasis on the clinical perspectives of audiology and speech pathology.

courses.name: BIOC 421 Recombinant DNA Techniques
courses.description: Multi-week experiments involving contemporary nucleic acid research, cloning and recombinant protein engineering. Emphasis is on experimental design, critical analysis of data and scientific communication skills.  Restricted to Major students in Biochemistry.

courses.name: EOSC 221 Introductory Petrology
courses.description: Optical mineralogy and the classification and genesis of igneous, metamorphic and sedimentary rocks.

courses.name: THTR 250 Technical Production
courses.description: The construction and execution of scenery, costumes, properties, lighting, and sound for the stage.

courses.name: ECON 471 Economics of Nonrenewable Resources
courses.description: Application of economic analysis to the management of nonrenewable natural resources. Emphasis is placed on the economics of alternative energy sources. Other topics include mineral economics, criteria for the optimal use of resources, and measurement of resources.

courses.name: MINE 582 Maintenance Engineering
courses.description: The analytical foundation for maintenance of industrial plant equipment and mobile equipment in various production environments. Reliability theory, sensing technology and theory, risk analysis, and operations research applied to maintenance management.

courses.name: FREN 423A Studies in Theatre - STDY IN THEATRE
courses.prerequisites: One of FREN 320, FREN 321, FREN 328, FREN 329, FREN 330.

courses.name: EDUC 495E Practicum (Elementary) for Previously Certified Teachers - TEACH PRACT ELEM
courses.description: Pass/Fail.
courses.prerequisites: (Completion of recent elementary teaching methods courses in the subjects to be taught.)

courses.name: CHEM 502 Advanced Physical Chemistry of the Solid State
courses.description: Credit will not be given for both CHEM 502 and CHEM 410.

courses.name: MINE 556 Rock Slope Engineering
courses.description: Geologic investigations and field and laboratory testing; detailed review of the mechanisms of rock slope instability; the influence of geology, ground water and blasting on rock slope stability; design of stable rock slopes; monitoring of rock slope behaviour; stabilization or rock slope failures.

courses.name: STS 502 Core Seminar in Science and Technology Studies
courses.description: Thematizes the relations of historical, philosophical, literary, rhetorical, sociological, and anthropological approaches to science and technology.

courses.name: ANTH 495C Advanced Studies in Anthropology - ADV STUDIES ANTH
courses.description: An intensive examination of selected topics in Anthropology. Consult the Department for this year's offerings.

courses.name: KIN 402 Co-operative Work Placement
courses.description: Supervised, technical work experience in an established company or organization for a minimum of three months. Technical report. Restricted to students meeting the requirements of the School of Kinesiology and the Co-operative Education Program.  Pass/Fail.

courses.name: MEDD 412 Foundations of Medical Practice II
courses.description: Increasingly complex clinical presentations through integration of foundational and clinical sciences and clinical practice themes. Developmental, case-based approach fostering the development of evidence-based clinical reasoning and clinical skills. Pass/fail.

courses.name: FNH 473 Nutrition Education in the Community
courses.description: Theory and methods in nutrition education; factors affecting behaviour modification and health promotion. The practice of nutrition education through education, health care delivery or media systems.

courses.name: POLI 328C Topics in Comparative Politics - COMPARATIVE POLI
courses.description: Topics will vary from year to year. Consult the departmental website.

courses.name: CHBE 486 Waste Management for Resource Recovery
courses.description: Physico-chemical, thermal, and biological methods for purification of solid waste and wastewater, and conversion to bioproducts/industrial products, energy and clean water.

courses.name: KIN 464 Health Promotion and Physical Activity
courses.description: Current perspectives on health promotion and health education; design and implementation of health promotion strategies in a variety of arenas, particularly health promotion/education strategies aimed at encouraging physical activity.

courses.name: CSPW 100 Coordinated Science Program Workshop
courses.description: Students participate in activities related to their CSP courses, including hands-on work, discussion and analysis of scientific topics. Graded Pass/Fail.

courses.name: APSC 160 Introduction to Computation in Engineering Design
courses.description: Analysis and simulation, laboratory data acquisition and processing, measurement interfaces, engineering tools, computer systems organization, programming languages. Credit will only be given for one of: APSC 160, CPSC 301, or EOSC 211.

courses.name: MICB 448C Directed Research - DIRECTED RESRCH
courses.description: A library (3 credits) or laboratory (3 or 6 credits) project. Requires permission of the Undergraduate Advisor. The results are presented in a written report to be reviewed by oral examination.
courses.prerequisites: Either (a) MICB 323 or (b) all of MICB 322, MICB 399.

courses.name: POLI 345 Gender and Politics: Political Thought and Practice
courses.description: The role of gender in Western political theory and the implications for the practice of politics.

courses.name: ANTH 227 Introduction to Medical Anthropology
courses.description: An examination of health and illness, in their social and cultural contexts.

courses.name: EDST 520 Perspectives on Adult Education Practice
PLAN 548T Current Issues in Planning - INDIGENOUS COMM
courses.description: Each year the school may offer one or more courses on a topical issue covering recent advances in the field.

courses.name: ELEC 499B Undergraduate Thesis - UNDERGRAD THESIS
courses.description: Project in electrical engineering or computer engineering involving design, experimental and/or computer simulation work as selected from topics supplied by faculty members. An individual project thesis is to be prepared according to specifications available from the departmental office.

courses.name: ASIA 315 Japan from Feudal to Modern State
courses.description: Japanese history from 1600 to the Meiji Restoration. Political, economic, social and cultural forces which were involved in transforming Japan.

courses.name: MUSC 271B Music Performance (Secondary) - VOICE
courses.description: Private instruction, vocal or instrumental.

courses.name: MUSC 403I Selected Topics in Music - JAZZ ARRANGING 2
courses.description: See School of Music schedule for description and prerequisites. Restricted to B. Mus. and B.A. in Music students.

courses.name: ELEC 311 Electromagnetic Fields and Waves
courses.description: Waves and propagation; Maxwell's equations; applications including transmission lines; impedance matching and Smith charts; reflection and refraction; waveguides and antennas.
courses.prerequisites: One of EECE 261, ELEC 211 and either (a) all of MATH 101, MATH 263, MATH 265, MATH 267 or (b) all of MATH 101, MATH 253, MATH 264, MATH 265, MATH 267 or (c) all of MATH 101, MATH 253, MATH 256, MATH 264.

courses.name: JAPN 410 Advanced Oral Communication
courses.description: Oral communication skills appropriate for studying and working in a Japanese-speaking environment either formal or informal.
courses.prerequisites: JAPN 301 and one of JAPN 303, JAPN 315.

courses.name: MATH 101 Integral Calculus with Applications to Physical Sciences and Engineering
courses.description: The definite integral, integration techniques, applications, modeling, infinite series. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: www.students.ubc.ca/calendar/index.cfm?tree=12,215,410,414.
courses.prerequisites: One of MATH 100, MATH 102, MATH 104, MATH 110, MATH 111, MATH 120, MATH 180, MATH 184.

courses.name: ASIA 356 Korean Cinema
courses.description: Introduction to the work of the major film makers.

courses.name: LING 201 Linguistic Theory and Analysis II
courses.description: Introduction to grammatical analysis; morphology, syntax, semantics; synchronic analysis and description with illustrations from various languages. Analytical practice and seminar discussion.

courses.name: COMM 355 Income Taxation
courses.description: A study of income tax from the standpoint of the individual and of business enterprise.

courses.name: PORT 110 Elementary Portuguese for Romance Language Speakers
courses.description: A single-term alternative to PORT 101 and 102 for students with heritage Portuguese or another Romance language. Credit will be granted for only one of PORT 110, PORT 101, or PORT 102.

courses.name: CHBE 351 Transport Phenomena II
courses.description: Heat and mass transfer; conduction and molecular diffusion; convective transfer; thermal radiation; analogies among heat, mass and momentum transfer; heat exchanger design.

courses.name: MICB 203 Basic Microbiology Laboratory
courses.description: Procedures and principles associated with isolation, characterization and handling of microorganisms. Intended for students requiring a basic microbiology laboratory course.

courses.name: CLST 320 Slavery in the Ancient Greek and Roman World
courses.description: The study and history of slavery in the Greek and Roman worlds as a political, legal, economic, social, and cultural phenomenon.

courses.name: BMEG 554A Directed Studies in Biomedical Engineering - DR STD BIOMD ENG
FMED 404 Fluids, Electrolytes, Renal and GU
courses.description: An introduction to the anatomy, histology, anatomical and histopathology of the kidney and urinary system and renal physiology and the major fluid and electrolyte disorders associated with renal dysfunction. Students are also introducted to the principles of diagnosis and management of genitourinary and renal disorders.

courses.name: ASIA 570A Approaches to Asian Literature - APPR TO ASIA LIT
FREN 473B Syntactic Description of the French Language - FREN SYNT DESCRP
courses.description: The syntactic markings of French (word order, agreement, pronominalisation, etc) and their underlying semantic systems.
courses.corequisites: (FREN 353 and 370 may be taken concurrently with the permission of the instructor.)

courses.name: CHEM 208 Coordination Chemistry
courses.description: Fundamental concepts and principles governing bonding and reactivity of coordination complexes: ligand field theory; symmetry and point groups; frontier molecular orbital theory.

courses.name: MATH 220 Mathematical Proof
courses.description: Sets and functions; induction; cardinality;  properties of the real numbers; sequences, series, and limits. Logic, structure, style, and clarity of proofs emphasized throughout.
courses.prerequisites: Either (a) a score of 64% or higher in one of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, SCIE 001 or (b) one of MATH 121, MATH 200, MATH 217, MATH 226, MATH 253, MATH 263.

courses.name: CONS 449C Directed Studies in Natural Resources Conservation - DIR ST NTL RS CN
courses.description: In special cases and with the approval of the instructor concerned, a student may carry out directed studies of specific problems in natural resources conservation.

courses.name: SOWK 570F Directed Studies in Social Work - DIRECTED STUDY
THTR 547B Directed Studies in Theatre and Drama and Film/Television - DIRECTED STUDIES
HIST 325 Canada 1896-1945: Boom, Bust and War
courses.description: Includes Aboriginal policy, immigration and national identity; Canada, Britain and the US; World Wars; economic modernization; the Great Depression; regionalism; political and social movements; and the creation of 'Canadian' culture.  Credit will only be granted for one of HIST 325 or 426, if 426 was taken before 2007W.

courses.name: MATH 310 Abstract Linear Algebra
courses.description: Linear spaces, duality, linear mappings, matrices, determinant and trace, spectral theory, Euclidean structure. Consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: www.students.ubc.ca/calendar/index.cfmtree=12,215,410,414.
courses.prerequisites: One of MATH 152, MATH 221 and one of MATH 220, MATH 226, CPSC 121.

courses.name: ENGL 229A Topics in the Study of Language and/or Rhetoric - LANG / RHETORIC
courses.prerequisites: Either (a) ARTS 001 or (b) two of ENGL 100, ENGL 110, ENGL 111, ENGL 112, ENGL 120, ENGL 121 or (c) ASTU 100 or (d) ASTU 150 and one of ENGL 110, ENGL 111, ENGL 120, ENGL 121;  or (e) WRDS 150 and one of ENGL 110, ENGL 111, ENGL 120, ENGL 121. (Or 6 credits of first-year English.)

courses.name: BIOL 447 Principles and Methodology in Biological Research

courses.name: MUSC 131 Class Voice

courses.name: CLST 353 The Early Roman Empire
courses.description: Roman imperial history during the Julio-Claudian and Flavian periods (30 BC-96 AD).

courses.name: EPSE 308 Human Development, Learning, and Diversity
courses.description: Pass/Fail.

courses.name: PCTH 498 Co-operative Work Placement III
courses.description: Approved and supervised technical work experience in an industrial research setting for a minimum of 3.5 months. Technical report required. Restricted to students admitted to the Co-operative Education Program in Pharmacology.

courses.name: BMEG 597 Master of Engineering Project

courses.name: LIBR 579M Topics in the Management of Libraries and Archives - MGMT LIB & ARCHV
BAFI 580B Special Topics in Finance - TPCS FINANCE

courses.description: Students assume a primary care role in clinical placements in midwifery practices across the provinces.  Demonstration of independent decision making and application of the full range of their academic knowledge to professional practice.  A practicum under the supervision of a registered midwife.  Pass/Fail.

courses.name: EECE 527 Advanced Computer Architecture
courses.description: Modern processor design with an emphasis on superscalar microarchitecture. Topics include: Quantitative principles, pipelining, memory hierarchy, multithreading, advanced instruction flow, and data flow techniques.

courses.name: MTRL 460 Monitoring and Optimization of Materials Processing
courses.description: Measurement systems for materials processing and evaluation, methods of data collection and analysis in materials engineering, materials processing monitoring and control, design of experiments for materials processing and optimization.

courses.name: COMM 436 Information Systems Analysis and Design
courses.description: The process of information systems development; modern techniques and tools for systems analysis and design.

courses.name: MECH 366 Modeling of Mechatronic Systems
courses.description: Modeling of mechanical, electrical, thermal, fluid elements and mixed mechatronic systems. Signal processing, signal conditioning. Sensors, data acquisition systems, actuators.
courses.prerequisites: Either (a) all of MECH 220, MECH 223, MECH 224, MECH 225 or (b) all of ENPH 253, MECH 260 and one of ELEC 201, EECE 251.

courses.name: CENS 307 Witches: Myth and Reality
courses.description: Examination of the cultural, social, and historical construction of the witch in central and northern Europe with comparisons to recent history, current events, and popular culture.

courses.name: DENT 527 Prosthodontic Treatment Planning and Outcomes Seminars I
DENT 514 The Pediatric Patient II
courses.description: Continues in year 3.

courses.name: CONS 452 Global Perspectives Capstone
courses.description: Examination of global resources and sustainability via scenario evaluation, modelling, and prescription.
courses.prerequisites: One of CONS 340, GEOB 270. (and fourth year standing in the Global Perspectives Major.)

courses.name: GERM 210 Intermediate German II
courses.description: Competence and fluency in everyday situations; ability to report and narrate past events fluently and to express opinions; familiarity with contemporary issues in the German-speaking societies; introduction to German for professional purposes.

courses.name: OBST 504 Reproductive Endocrinology II
courses.description: Lectures and seminars on cellular processes in hormone secretion, steroid biosynthesis, steroid transport and metabolism, mechanism of hormone action, prostaglandins in reproduction.

courses.name: CCFI 590 Graduating Paper
courses.description: Pass/Fail.

courses.name: EPSE 681B Advanced Topics in Measurement, Evaluation, and Research - ADV TOPCS MERM
courses.prerequisites: (Courses appropriate to a specific advanced topic may be required.)

courses.name: SPHA 543 Information Technology for Management
courses.description: A general introduction to the role of IT in management, how IT has changed the nature of the modern business world, how IT can be used to achieve strategic advantages, how IT can improve one's own effectiveness as a manager.

courses.name: FISH 506E Current Topics in Fisheries - HIST  FISHERIES
COHR 307 Introduction to Organizational Consulting
courses.description: Frameworks from the social sciences useful for understanding organizational processes and how to apply these frameworks to particular organizational consulting challenges.
courses.prerequisites: COMM 292 and one of COMM 203, COMM 392.

courses.name: COMM 657 Empirical Methods in Accounting Research
GEOB 308 Quaternary and Applied Geomorphology
courses.description: Quaternary landscape development emphasizing the history of glaciation with special reference to western North America; applications of geomorphology in resource development and land management; interpretation of quaternary materials. Weekend field trips required.

courses.name: PCTH 400 Systematic Pharmacology
courses.description: Lectures and discussions in scientific pharmacology. All aspects of the study of drugs will be covered, but the course will concentrate on the scientific aspects of the pharmacology of neurohumoral transmission, mathematics of pharmacology, cardiovascular and clinical pharmacology, and to a lesser extent on the pharmacology of various organs and tissues.

courses.name: FOOD 515 Fundamentals of Agri-Food Business
courses.description: Credit will be granted for only one of FNH 415, FOOD 515 or FRE 515.

courses.name: BUSI 329 Principles of Organizational Behaviour
courses.description: An introductory examination of work organizations and the behaviour of individuals within them.  Phenomena to be studied include organizational structure, evironments, group processes, motivation and leadership.

courses.name: MEDI 548D Directed Studies in Experimental Medicine - DST IN EXPTL MED
ARCH 545E Directed Studies in Architecture - DRECTD STDY ARCH
courses.description: Directed research and exploration of selected topics in architecture.

courses.name: SPPH 517 Clinical Research methods for Surgical Procedures
COMM 293 Financial Accounting
courses.description: Introduction to the construction and interpretation of financial reports prepared primarily for external use. Credit will be granted for only one of COMM 293 or COEC 293.

courses.name: BIOL 434 Population Genetics
courses.description: Theoretical and experimental aspects of population and quantitative genetics.
courses.prerequisites: BIOL 336 and either (a) BIOL 200 and one of BIOL 233, BIOL 234;  or (b) one of BIOL 334, FRST 302.

courses.name: ANTH 417B Language, Culture, and Cognition - LANG,CULT&COGNTN
courses.description: The relationships between linguistic and cultural phenomena; how language affects normative and cognitive systems of thought and behaviour.
courses.prerequisites: One of ANTH 100, LING 200. (May be taken as co-requisites.)

courses.name: CPSC 310 Introduction to Software Engineering
courses.description: Specification, design, implementation and maintenance of large, multi-module software systems. Principles, techniques, methodologies and tools for computer aided software engineering (CASE); human-computer interfaces, reactive systems, hardware-software interfaces and distributed applications.

courses.name: VANT 140C Content and Language Enrichment Tutorials - CONTENT LANG TUT
courses.description: Sustained language support for linked content courses in International Program. Students develop strategies for self-directed learning.

courses.name: EECE 528 Parallel and Reconfigurable Computing
courses.description: Matching software parallelism to parallel hardware systems.  Flynn's classification; Amdahl's Law; levels of parallelism; extra parallel work; communication; message passing; shared memory; vecor programming; custom instruction set design; high-level synthesis; processor arrays; FPGAs.

courses.name: STAT 241 Introductory Probability and Statistics
courses.description: Probability models, random variables and vectors, estimation, testing, regression, analysis of variance, goodness of fit, quality control. (Consult the Credit Exclusion list within the Faculty of Science section of the Calendar).
courses.prerequisites: One of MATH 200, MATH 217, MATH 226, MATH 253, MATH 263.

courses.name: CELL 507 Special Techniques and Protocols in Cell and Developmental Biology
MIDW 205 Midwifery Theory for Primary Care
courses.description: Care of normal pregnancy, labour, birth, and puerperium with an empahsis on the intrapartum period and assessment and management skills.  Inludes a four-week intensive session in Vancouver, a series of online tutorials, and simulation and skills lab practice.

courses.name: CRWR 203 Introduction to Writing for Children and Young Adults
courses.description: Techniques of and practice in creating, developing and writing for children and young adults. Manuscript submission is not required for admission.

courses.name: BUSI 460 Critical Analysis and Forecasting in Real Estate
courses.description: Delves into two quantitative decision-making methodologies ? decision analysis and forecasting ? and explores them using a problem-solving framework.
courses.prerequisites: BUSI 121. (BUSI 331 and BUSI 444 are also recommended.)

courses.name: EPSE 449 Education of Students with Autism
KIN 489M Seminar - SEMINAR
courses.description: Current topics and research in specific areas.
courses.prerequisites: (Fourth-year standing. Consult with Advisor for specific prerequisites.)

courses.name: PHYS 555B Directed Studies in Physics - DIRECTED STUDIES
courses.description: With approval of the department head, advanced studies under the direction of a staff member may be arranged in special cases.

courses.name: MTRL 394 Polymer and Polymer Matrix Composites
courses.description: The structure and properties of polymeric materials, reinforced polymers and polymer matrix composites with emphasis on their engineering properties and applications.

courses.name: SPHA 551 Design and Measurement 1
courses.description: Basic concepts and methods in Epidemiology.

courses.name: MINE 396 Engineering Economics
courses.description: Discrete and continuous cash flow models, discounted cash flow analysis, effects of depreciation and taxes, economic analysis of projects, sensitivity and risk analysis, financing and cost of capital.

courses.name: EDUC 500 Research Methodology in Education
courses.description: Overview of methodological approaches to research in education.

courses.name: GEOG 446 Topics in Geography
courses.description: See the departmental undergraduate adviser for details.

courses.name: COMM 329 Principles of Organizational Behaviour
courses.description: An introductory examination of work organizations and the behaviour of individuals within them. Phenomena to be studied include organizational structure, environments, group processes, motivation and leadership (for non-Commerce students only).

courses.name: COMM 498 International Business Management
courses.description: Development of general environmental framework for international business studies by drawing on international and development economics, research into government-business relations and studies in comparative socio-cultural systems and political systems. Credit will be granted for only one of COMM 498 or COEC 498.

courses.name: CHEM 516A Topics in Biophysical Chemistry - BIOPHYSICAL CHEM
CPSC 110 Computation, Programs, and Programming
courses.description: Fundamental program and computation structures. Introductory programming skills. Computation as a tool for information processing, simulation and modeling, and interacting with the world.

courses.name: FRST 443 Remote Sensing for Ecosystem Management
courses.description: Basic biological concepts related to interpretation of remote sensing data for land management, including the use of films and filters, and interpretation of air photographs, and other imagery.

courses.name: LAW 569C Topics in International Taxation - TPCS INTL TAXATN
courses.description: Credit will be granted for only one of LAW 414 or LAW 569.

courses.name: GRSJ 425A Special Topics in Gender, Race, and Sexuality - SP TPC GND,RC,SX
courses.description: Examination in depth of selected topics in gender, race, and sexuality. Consult the Student Service Centre course schedule for course offerings. May be repeated for credit.

courses.name: CHBE 230 Computational Methods

courses.name: PHAR 543 Advanced Laboratory in Pharmacology
courses.description: A laboratory course giving instruction in the methods and techniques used in pharmacological research. Registration limited.

courses.prerequisites: One of EECE 253, ELEC 202, EECE 269, ELEC 221.

courses.name: ANTH 400A History of Anthropology - HISTORY OF ANTH
courses.description: The development of anthropological theory and practice in institutional contexts.

courses.name: PSYC 319 Applied Developmental Psychology
courses.description: Applications of theories and research in developmental psychology to contemporary social issues; topics may include daycare, child abuse, divorce and remarriage, substance abuse, sexuality.
courses.prerequisites: Either (a) PSYC 100 or (b) all of PSYC 101, PSYC 102. (or (c) 6 credits of 200-level Psychology (but not 205 or 263).)

courses.name: PHIL 321A Induction and Decision - INDUCTION & DECN
courses.description: Formal methods relevant to the logic of decision. Decision theory, game theory, axiomatic probability theory and its interpretations, belief dynamics, simulation and modelling.

courses.name: MECH 599B Thesis - MASC THESIS
courses.description: For M.A.Sc.

courses.name: MUSC 336 Opera Theatre Techniques I

courses.name: CRWR 570M Advanced Special Projects in Creative Writing - ADV PROJCTS CRWR

courses.description: Introduction to the construction and interpretation of financial reports prepared primarily for external use.

courses.name: COMM 290 Introduction to Quantitative Decision Making
courses.description: Introduction to decision models in business, including basic optimization, linear programming, probability, decision analysis, random variables, simulation, and solving decision problems using spreadsheet tools.

courses.name: PHAR 451 Therapeutics III

courses.name: ETEC 565G Special Course in Subject Matter Field - SC SUB MAT FIELD

courses.name: HIST 351A East Central Europe in the 19th and 20th Centuries - E&C EURO 19/20 C
courses.description: Covers the region between Germany and Russia as well as Southeast Europe. Emphasis on comparisons with Western Europe and features that make the area significant to Europe as a whole.

courses.name: LAW 452 Succession
courses.description: The law of wills and intestate succession, variation of wills, principles of probate and administration of estates.

courses.name: ARST 580 Records, Archives, and the Law

courses.name: ANTH 317A Linguistic Anthropology - LINGUISTIC ANTH
courses.description: A survey of the ethnographic uses of language data and the techniques of linguistic analysis.

courses.name: CHEM 524 Chemistry of Organometallic Compounds
courses.description: Credit will not be given for both CHEM 418 and CHEM 524.

courses.name: EPSE 501 Seminar in Human Development, Learning and Culture
EPSE 529 Development of Scales and Measures

courses.description: Topics as for MATH 100, but including relevant topics from algebra, geometry, functions, trigonometry, logarithms, and exponentials.
courses.prerequisites: (Pre-requisite: BC Principles of Mathematics 12 or Pre-calculus 12 (or equivalent), plus permission of the Mathematics Department; permission will normally be based on a low grade in BC Principles of Mathematics 12 or Pre-calculus 12 (or equivalent) and a low score in the optional UBC Mathematics Basic Skills Test if taken. See http://www.math.ubc.ca/Ugrad/m110.shtml for details. )

courses.name: ANTH 403B Ethnography of Special Areas - JPNS TEA CEREMNY

courses.name: BIOL 548O Advanced Topics in Biology - ADV TOPICS BIOL

courses.description: Topics not covered in a course. A pilot course may be offered under this name for only one year and with permission of the Associate Dean (Teacher Education).

courses.name: MUSC 141 Class Piano I
courses.description: Required of all first-time secondary piano students.

courses.name: MDVL 301 European Literature from the 5th to the 14th Century
courses.description: Selected works from the 5th to the 14th centuries in their cultural and social contexts.
courses.prerequisites: (Third-year standing in the Faculty of Arts.)

courses.name: FOOD 524 Advances in Food Process Science
