courses.description: Italian literature of the 19th century in its intellectual, socio-political and cultural context. Precludes credit for ITST 418.

courses.name: ECON 374 Land Economics
courses.description: Economic analysis applied to problems of land use. Rent theory. Land valuation. Land conservation. Techniques for assessing economic efficiency of land use. Effects of institutions and public policies on land use.

courses.name: ECON 557 Empirical Topics in International Economics

courses.description: Sustainability and environmental stewardship; environmental impact assessment legislation; design and construction considerations useful in minimizing and mitigating such impacts.

courses.name: MUSC 569B Intensive Specialized Chamber Ensemble - INT SPC CHMB ENS
courses.description: Intensive coaching.

courses.name: PHIL 485 Directed Reading
courses.description: Same as PHIL 486-9.

courses.name: MINE 590K Special Advanced Topics - MINING SYSTEM

Natural processes (physical, chemical, and biological) affecting the ultimate fate and impact of these pollutants.

courses.name: CHBE 492 Thesis
courses.description: Research project under the direction of a staff member.

courses.name: WOOD 386 Applied Mechanics of Materials
courses.description: Beam analysis, shaft analysis, columns, stress/strain transformations, thin-walled pressure vessels, material strength failure, criteria, fatigue, design and sizing, ISO standards.

courses.name: DENT 561C Directed Studies in Dental Sciences - DST DENTAL SCIE
MUSC 593C Music Performance (Major) - STRING INST'S
courses.description: Private instruction, vocal or instrumental. May be repeated for credit, in accordance with program requirements.

courses.name: MUSC 550C Large Instrumental Ensemble - LARGE INST ENSEM
courses.description: Symphony Orchestra or Wind Ensemble. Open only to graduate students.

courses.name: CPSC 301 Computing in the Life Sciences

Applications and examples drawn from the life sciences. No prior computing background is required. Not for credit for students who have credit for any of the following: APSC 160, Computer Science AP, IB Computer Science, EOSC 211, or 3 credits of CPSC beyond CPSC 101.

courses.name: ASIA 317 The Rise of Korean Civilization

courses.name: FREN 343 French Practice for Non-Specialists II

courses.name: STAT 344 Sample Surveys

Random sampling, bias and variance, unequal probability sampling, systematic, multistage and stratified sampling, ratio and regression estimators, post-stratification, establishing a frame, pretesting, pilot studies, nonresponse and additional topics.

courses.name: CNPS 594 Cross-Cultural Counselling

courses.name: FIPR 547A Directed Studies in Film Production - DIR ST FILM PROD
PHIL 240A Knowledge and Reality I - KNOW & REALITY I

courses.name: LAW 221 Criminal Law and Procedure

courses.name: CPEN 211 Introduction to Microcomputers

courses.name: EOSC 326 Earth and Life Through Time
courses.description: The fossil record of adaptation and extinction emphasizing the interaction of biological and geological processes. Not for credit in any Earth, Ocean and Atmospheric Sciences specialization. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: www.students.ubc.ca/calendar/index.cfm?tree=12,215,410,414.

courses.name: PHYS 474 Applied Solid State Physics
courses.description: Symmetry of crystal structures, reciprocal lattice, band theory, conduction in metals and semiconductors, phonons and superconductivity.

courses.name: CNPS 363 Career Counselling
courses.description: Critical survey of career counselling theory and practice.

courses.name: CHBE 464 Chemical and Biological Engineering Laboratory
courses.description: Experiments in unit operations relating to process, environmental and biological engineering. Experiments are designed to provide experience in instrumentation and control. Field trips may be required.
courses.prerequisites: All of CHBE 345, CHBE 356, CHBE 362 and one of CHBE 365, CHBE 366.

courses.name: THTR 317 Introduction to Directing
courses.prerequisites: One of THTR 130, THTR 230 and THTR 299.

courses.name: GRSJ 422 Advanced Research Seminar
courses.description: Critical theories, methodologies, ethics and practices appropriate for advanced feminist research.
courses.prerequisites: Either (a) all of GRSJ 101, GRSJ 102 or (b) all of WMST 101, WMST 102. (or third-year standing.)

courses.name: EDST 403 Education, Knowledge, and Curriculum
courses.description: Pass/Fail.

courses.name: ASIA 351 Modern Chinese Fiction in Translation
courses.description: Reading of selected novels and stories written between 1750 and the present.

courses.name: MINE 462 Coal Preparation Technology
courses.description: Thermal and metallurgical coals: objectives of their cleaning; coal washability and flotability fundamentals; coal preparation unit operations; performance characteristics of coal washing equipment; products dewatering; plant flowsheets.

courses.name: LLED 565E Special Course in Subject Matter Field - SPC C SUBJ MTFLD
courses.description: Courses in various subject matter fields designed to bring teachers up to date in recent findings in each field.

courses.name: ENGL 546A Studies in Commonwealth/Post-colonial Literatures - CMMNWLTH/POSTCOL
BIOL 448C Directed Studies in Biology - DIRECTED STUDIES
courses.description: A course designed to allow students to undertake an investigation on a specific topic as agreed upon by the faculty member and the student. Permission of the supervisor required. No more than six credits of BIOL 448 may be taken with the same supervisor.

courses.name: ARTH 312 Medieval Art in the Age of Monasticism
courses.description: Art in Western Europe between 1000 and 1200; the role of monasteries as leading institutions and patrons of art and large scale architecture. Credit will be granted for only one of ARTH 312 or ARTH 332.

courses.name: HIST 270A China in World History - CHINA WORLD HIST
courses.description: The history of China in a global context, from the earliest times to the most recent past; how China has changed the world and how engagement with the world has changed China.

courses.name: MATH 444 Mathematical Research and Writing
courses.description: Current research topics in pure and applied mathematics are explored at the undergraduate level.  Technical communication and research skills are developed.
courses.prerequisites: One of MATH 220, MATH 226. (and 6 credits of MATH courses numbered 300 or higher.)

courses.name: ENVR 300 Introduction to Research in Environmental Science
courses.description: Environmental research.  Students investigate research methodologies and reporting in a range of scientific disciplines and fields.
courses.prerequisites: (Open to all students with third-year, or higher, standing in the Faculty of Science.)

courses.name: LAW 561 Fundamental Concepts in Tax Law
CHEM 260 Organic Chemistry for Engineers
courses.description: A description of the properties and reactions of organic compounds.
courses.prerequisites: One of CHEM 113, CHEM 123, CHEM 154, SCIE 001.

courses.name: HGSE 350 Case Studies in Haida Gwaii
courses.description: Integration of concepts of history, politics, First Nations, rural development, and forest ecology in natural resources management in Haida Gwaii.  A core element of the Haida Gwaii Semester.

courses.name: NURS 302 Foundations for Professional Nursing Practice
courses.description: Introduction to fundamental theories, concepts, evidence, and competencies pertaining to the discipline and practice of nursing.

courses.name: FREN 512B Studies in Literary Criticism - LIT CRITICISM
LAW 407 Taxation
courses.description: A survey of the law and practice of income and capital gains taxes. Credit will be granted for only one of LAW 220, LAW 407, or LAW 506.

courses.name: MUSC 557 Early Music Ensemble
courses.description: Open only to graduate students.

courses.name: SOCI 433C Directed Studies - DIRECTED STUDIES
courses.description: General reading and/or a research undertaking, with the agreement, and under the supervision, of a Department faculty member selected by the student.

courses.name: IGEN 452 Pipeline Design
courses.description: Pipeline and pipeline system design reflecting applicable policies, regulations, design codes, and design guidelines; construction management and construction techniques; risk assessment and mitigation; linear optimization; route selection; field monitoring and testing; technical design project.

courses.name: FREN 101 Beginners' French I
courses.description: Grammar, composition, reading and oral practice.  Not available to students with the prerequisite for FREN 102.

courses.name: ENGL 330A The Structure of Modern English: Sounds and Words - ENGL STRUCTURE 1
courses.description: An introduction to phonology, morphology, and lexical semantics.

courses.name: CPSC 536H Topics in Algorithms and Complexity - EMPIRICAL ALGOR
LING 101 Languages of the World
courses.description: A survey of the linguistic map of the world, examining how languages are genetically classified and how different languages evolve. Principles underlying different writing systems and the decipherment of historical documents. Issues of languages in contact, minority language endangerment, language death and the role of English as a world language. Recommended but not required for an honours, major, or minor in linquistics or speech sciences.

courses.name: PHYS 157 Introductory Physics for Engineers I
courses.description: Heat, thermodynamics, oscillations, waves, and sound. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: www.students.ubc.ca/calendar/index.cfm?tree=12,215,410,414.
courses.corequisites: One of MATH 100, MATH 102, MATH 104, MATH 110, MATH 120, MATH 180, MATH 184.

courses.name: STAT 398 Co-operative Work Placement I
courses.description: Work experience in an industrial research setting. Normally taken during Winter Session of third year. Restricted to students admitted to the Co-operative Education Program in Statistics.
courses.prerequisites: (Registration in Statistics Honours or Major Program.)

courses.name: PHIL 425A Philosophy of Language I - PHIL LANGUAGE 1
courses.description: Philosophical discussion of language, meaning, and communication.
courses.prerequisites: (Philosophy or linguistics courses totaling 9 credits at the 200-level or above.)

courses.name: FREN 513B Studies in French-Canadian Literature - FR CANADIAN LIT
SPHA 511 Government, Business and Health Care Policy
BUSI 455 Principles of Auditing

courses.name: ARTH 540C Studies in 20th Century Art - 20TH CENT ART

courses.prerequisites: All of EOSC 323, EOSC 330 and one of EOSC 321, EOSC 322.

courses.name: LARC 531 Landscape Technologies I

PATH 417A Human Bacterial Infections - HMN BACT INFCTNS
courses.description: Students acquire content relating to the virulence factors of the bacteria and the pathophysiology of the host while working through case scenarios on their own and in online groups. Students taking this course must be willing to engage in both self-directed and small-group learning.

courses.name: POLI 562C Topics in International Relations - TOP IN INTER REL
AUDI 547F Directed Reading in Audiology and Speech Sciences - DIR READ AUDI&SP
courses.description: May be taken more than once.

courses.name: BIOC 548C Directed Studies - DIRECTED STUDIES
courses.description: In special cases, with approval of the department head, advanced courses may be arranged for graduate students in attendance.

courses.name: BUSI 400 Residential Property Analysis
courses.description: Underlying theory and techniques used in design, construction, and inspection of residential properties.

courses.name: ATSC 212 Earth and Atmospheric Science Introductory Computing Laboratory
courses.description: Computing tools, including Unix/Linux, Web page creation, programming languages used for numerical calculation, database programs.

courses.name: ARCH 571B Seminar: Technology and Analysis - CRFT ARCH DTLNG
courses.description: Topics across a range of building material and construction technology-based subject matter.

courses.name: PATH 501 Foundations of Human Histopathology
courses.description: Microscopic anatomy of human tissues and organs in health and disease. Principles of histological analysis and applications in pathology.

courses.name: MATH 437 Number Theory
courses.description: Divisibility, congruences, Diophantine equations, arithmetic functions, quadratic reciprocity, advanced topics. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: www.students.ubc.ca/calendar/index.cfm?tree=12,215,410,414.

courses.name: EECE 549 Dynamic Modeling of Electric Machines and Controls
courses.description: Numerical aspects of time-domain simulation are reviewed. Dynamic modeling and analysis of power systems components including transformers, induction and synchronous machines, inverters, electric drives and associated controls.

courses.name: CRWR 404B Writing for Radio I - WRIT RADIO I
courses.description: A workshop class in writing for the radio. Admission is restricted to B.F.A. Majors in Creative Writing.

courses.name: HIST 490P Seminar for Majors in History - SEM FOR HIST MAJ
courses.description: Selected problems in the theory and practice of historical work. Check with the department for course offerings. Restricted to fourth year students majoring in History or in the History and Philosophy of Science. Also open to History Honours students.

courses.name: SOWK 400 Canadian Social Policy
courses.description: Analysis of race, gender, class and culture as factors in the distribution and delivery of Canadian social benefits and social services.

courses.name: DHYG 405 Oral Microbiology and Immunology
courses.description: Microbiology and immunological concepts relevant for dental hygiene practice.

courses.name: CAPS 430 Advanced Laboratory in Physiology
courses.description: Methods, techniques, and use of instruments required for physiological investigation. CAPS 303 or PHYL 303 and the consent of the department are required and enrolment will be limited.

courses.name: EDUC 496I Practicum (Secondary) for Previously Certified Teachers - TEACH PRACT SECD
courses.description: Pass/Fail.
courses.prerequisites: (Recent completion of secondary teaching methods courses in the subjects to be taught.)

courses.name: MATH 190 Calculus Survey
courses.description: Functions, derivatives, integrals, curve sketching growth functions, volume calculations.  Only for credit in the Faculty of Forestry.  Students with credit for MATH 100, 102, 104, 120, 180, or 184 cannot in the same term or later terms obtain credit for MATH 190.
courses.prerequisites: (Principles of Mathematics 12 or Pre-calculus 12 and registration in the B.S.F. or B.Sc.N. programs.)

courses.name: EDCP 323 Outdoor Environmental Education: Curriculum and Pedagogy
courses.description: Costs for field trips and an overnight experience are borne by students. Pass/Fail.

courses.name: CHIN 473 Later Classical Chinese Poetry (after Tang)
courses.description: Readings in classical poetry from the Song to the Qing dynasties, at an advanced level. Not to be taken concurrently with any CHIN courses lower than 400-level. Credit will be granted for only one of CHIN 473 or 474.
courses.prerequisites: One of CHIN 313, CHIN 314, CHIN 317, CHIN 318, CHIN 323.

courses.name: LAW 461 Corporate Transactions
courses.description: Legal aspects of selected transactions relating to public corporations and corporate governance. Not offered each year, consult Faculty.

courses.name: ARST 620 Advanced Study in Minor Area
FREN 329 Selected Works of European French Literature
courses.description: Representative works viewed in their historical, social, and cultural contexts.

courses.name: STAT 404 Design and Analysis of Experiments
courses.description: Theory and application of analysis of variance for standard experimental designs, including blocked, nested, factorial and split plot designs. Fixed and random effects, multiple comparisons, analysis of covariance. (Consult the Credit Exclusion list within the Faculty of Science section in the Calendar).

courses.name: ENGL 357M Restoration and Eighteenth-Century Studies - RES & 18TH CENT
courses.prerequisites: (3rd year standing and 6 credits of first-year English, or Arts One, or 6 credits of ASTU 100 from CAP or 3 credits of first-year English and 3 credits of ASTU 150)

courses.name: BAEN 506 Entrepreneurship Technology and Non-Technology Streams I
LLED 577 Culture and Politics in Second Language Education
LLED 446 Teaching with Illustrated Materials, K-12: From Picture Books to Information Texts
BIOL 336 Fundamentals of Evolutionary Biology
courses.description: Natural selection; population genetics, quantitative genetics and systematics; classical and molecular approaches to the study of evolution.

courses.name: RMES 500X Resource and Environmental Workshop - INT ENV JUST
courses.description: Faculty and students from different disciplines act as an interdisciplinary team studying specific resource problems with ecological, economic, demographic and social dimensions. Techniques and methods are emphasized to show their value in integrating knowledge, defining policy and facilitating communication. Several sections with different emphasis offered each year.

courses.name: DENT 724 Clinical Endodontics, Year 3
courses.description: Endodontic treatment of patients in the clinic under the supervision of specialist instructors. Supervised endodontic treatment clinic.

courses.name: CLST 105 Greek and Roman Mythology
courses.description: Greek and Roman mythology and its interpretation. Emphasis on ancient texts read in English translation.

courses.name: GRS 497E Regional Directed Field Studies - REG DIR FLD STUD
courses.description: Participating students may be assessed a fee.

courses.name: EDST 690 Ed.D. Thesis
courses.description: Pass/Fail.

courses.name: EDUC 490L Special Studies in Education - SPEC STUDIES ED
courses.description: Topics not covered in a course. A pilot course may be offered under this name for only one year and with permission of the Associate Dean (Teacher Education).

courses.name: CHBE 457 Process Synthesis
courses.description: Strategy for the conceptual design of industrial chemical and biological processes; rules of thumb for chemical engineers, simulation to assist process synthesis, reactor-separator network synthesis, introduction to product design and molecular structure design, efficiency and sustainability in the chemical industry.
courses.prerequisites: All of CHBE 241, CHBE 346, CHBE 376, CHBE 344.

courses.name: EDCP 357 Physics - Secondary: Curriculum and Pedagogy
courses.description: Pass/Fail.
courses.prerequisites: (A completed concentration in physics or permission of the Head.)

courses.name: CNPS 532C Psychological Assessment in Counselling - PSYC ASSESS CNSL
courses.description: The use of standardized measures of mental ability, achievement, aptitude, interest and personality.

courses.name: CELL 503 Current Topics in Cellular Communication
courses.description: Cellular communication within tissues by direct contact and by modulating and responding to the microenvironment.

courses.name: CHEM 448B Directed Studies in Chemistry - T2 DST CHEMISTRY
courses.description: Students will undertake an investigation of a specific topic as agreed upon by the student and the faculty supervisor. Open to third- and fourth-year chemistry students.

courses.name: ARTH 535A Early Modern: Renaissance - RENAISSANCE ART
ARTH 439 Seminar in 18th and 19th-Century Visual Culture
THTR 472 Advanced B.F.A. Acting II
courses.description: Open only to B.F.A. Acting students.

courses.name: EECE 571E Electrical Engineering Seminar and Special Problems - PARA COMP PLTFRM
AUDI 514A Hearing Science I - HEARING SCI I
MINE 522B Processing of Mineral Fines - PRO MIN FINES
courses.description: Particulate systems. Role of particle size and interfacial phenomena in properties of disperse systems. Stability of colloids and suspensions DLVO (Dejaguin-Landau-Vervey-Overbeek). Credit will be granted for only one of MINE 522 or MINE 572.

courses.name: LAST 100 Introduction to Latin American Studies
courses.description: An overview of the culture and society of Latin America from ancient to contemporary times and from Argentina to Mexico.

courses.name: LING 546B Directed Reading in Topics related to Linguistics - DIRECTED READING
DHYG 110 Dental Hygiene Theory and Practice I
courses.description: An introduction to the Dental Hygiene profession, practice roles and the process of care model.

courses.name: AUDI 685C Seminar in Language Development - SEM LANG DEVELOP
MUSC 649 Ph.D. Dissertation or D.M.A. Thesis
FNH 200 Exploring Our Food
courses.description: Chemical and physical properties of foods; issues pertaining to safety, nutritive value and consumer acceptability; government regulations pertaining to food safety, quality and additives; preservation techniques and transformation of agricultural commodities to food products; foods of the future.

courses.name: CLST 260 Gladiators, Games, and Spectacle in the Greek and Roman World
courses.description: History, development, and social function of various forms of spectacle in ancient Greece and Rome, from the Olympic games to the Roman arena.

courses.name: MICB 424 Cellular Dynamics of Pathogenic and Environmental Bacteria
courses.description: Regulatory and signalling networks in bacterial cells with emphasis on how cellular and environmental cues are detected and integrated during different growth or life history stages of important pathogenic and environmental bacteria.
courses.prerequisites: Either (a) MICB 301 or (b) all of MICB 201, MICB 325.

courses.name: LLED 493B Supervised Study in Modern Languages Education - SPR ST MDN LANG
MUSC 569A Intensive Specialized Chamber Ensemble - INT SPC CHMB ENS
courses.description: Intensive coaching.

courses.name: CHBE 381 Bioprocess Engineering I
courses.description: Design of industrial bioreactor systems: organism selection; kinetics of microbial processes and enzyme reactions; design and modeling of single and multi-stage bioreactors.
courses.prerequisites: BIOL 112 and one of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, CHBE 241, CHBE 251. (Third or fourth year standing.)

courses.name: CIVL 413 Design of Earth Dams and Containment Structures
courses.description: Purpose and types of dams; design criteria; construction sequence; compaction; seepage; filter design; factors influencing the design of earth dams; stability and deformation under static and earthquake loading; slope protection; field instrumentation.

courses.name: WOOD 282 Wood Physics and Mechanics
courses.description: Wood-moisture relationships, transport phenomena, acoustical and electrical properties of wood. Effects of wood attributes at macro- and micro-levels on the strength properties of solid wood.

courses.name: GRS 497B Regional Directed Field Studies - REG DIR FLD STUD
courses.description: Participating students may be assessed a fee.

courses.name: CHBE 459 Chemical and Biological Engineering Economics
courses.description: Estimation of capital and operating costs; interest calculations; taxes; economic comparison of alternatives; economic optimization.

courses.name: BIOL 337 Introductory Genetics Laboratory
courses.description: A laboratory course demonstrating the fundamental principles of inheritance: Mendel's Laws, sex-linkage, mapping, mutagenesis, chromosome structure, developmental biology, biochemical and population genetics.

courses.name: CIVL 437 Introduction to Ship Structures
courses.description: Structural theory and practice of ship structural design; longitudinal and transverse strength of hull girder; plates and shells; matrix analysis; introduction to classification society rules; ship section design synthesis; finite element analysis.

courses.name: BIOL 346 Microbes and Society
courses.description: An elementary course in molecular biology primarily for Arts students. The historical development of recent discoveries in molecular biology with emphasis on bacteria and viruses and their interaction with humans. (Consult the Credit Exclusion list within the Faculty of Science section of the Calendar.) Not for credit in Life Sciences.

courses.name: SOWK 450 Social Work Practice in Community Mental Health
courses.description: Online course providing overview of social work services to persons with a mental illness.

courses.name: LING 447E Topics in Linguistics - TOPICS IN LING
courses.description: A capstone course for Linguistics and Speech Sciences majors, normally taken after three years of study.  Individual sections will differ substantially; see online Course List for detailed descriptions and prerequisites. May be repeated for credit when content is different.

courses.name: EPSE 415 Technology for the Visually Impaired
courses.description: Preparation of teachers to work with a variety of technological devices designed for students who are blind or visually impaired, e.g., computers, electronic reading devices, and closed circuit television. This course is restricted to students enrolled in a program for Education of Visually Impaired Children.

courses.name: ENGL 100 Reading and Writing about Literature
courses.description: A writing-intensive introduction to the disciplines of literary studies through the exploration of texts in their critical and theoretical contexts. Fulfils the first-year component of the Faculty of Arts Writing and Research Requirement. Open only to students in the Faculty of Arts. Recommended for students intending to become English majors. Essays are required.

courses.name: FRE 521E Topics in Food and Resource Economics - TOPICS IN FRE
GERM 200 Intermediate German I
courses.description: Competence and fluency in everyday situations; ability to report and narrate past events fluently and to express opinions; familiarity with contemporary issues in the German-speaking societies.

courses.name: BAAC 550 Foundations in  Accounting
courses.description: Same as HCEC 502; credit will not be given for both.

courses.name: CPEN 481 Economic Analysis of Engineering Projects
courses.description: Time-money relationships; economic analysis of alternatives including the effects of interest rates, inflation, depreciation, taxation and uncertainty; cost estimation and budgeting; financial analysis of engineering operations.

courses.name: WOOD 476 Design of Timber Structures
courses.description: Design of timber structural elements using limit states design principles; joints and fasteners, sawn lumber and engineered wood products, light frame systems and shear walls.

courses.name: VISA 583A MFA Research Seminar - MFA RSRCH SEMINR
CIVL 522 Project and Construction Economics
courses.description: Application of the principles of engineering economics, economics and systems analysis techniques to the mathematical modeling of civil engineering projects. Topics treated: modeling of capital expenditures, revenues and operating expenditures, project financing, sensitivity analysis, risk analysis and management.

courses.name: MUSC 407C Composition IV - COMPOSITION IV
courses.description: Continuation of MUSC 307.

courses.name: FIPR 434 Producing for Film and Television
courses.description: The creative and business aspects of producing for film and television.

courses.name: WOOD 493 Project in Program Major
courses.description: A report (approved by a faculty supervisor and the Program Director) based on either a technical description of a study, an extension of the senior co-op report, a detailed literature review, a research-based project, or a guided independent study developed by the student.

courses.name: MINE 497T Directed Studies - UNDERGRAD THESIS
courses.description: Requires approval of the department head.

courses.name: ECON 566 Business Performance and Public Policy
PSYC 304 Brain and Behaviour
courses.description: The neurobiological bases of behaviour; brain processes involved in perception, motivation, emotion, psychopathology, learning and memory. Open to all Arts and Science majors except those in the B.Sc. Psychology program. Credit will not be given for both PSYC 304 and PSYC 360.
courses.prerequisites: Either (a) PSYC 100 or (b) all of PSYC 101, PSYC 102 or (c) two of PSYC 207, PSYC 208, PSYC 217, PSYC 218 or (d) PSYC 260.

courses.name: ENGL 490 Literature Majors Seminar
courses.description: Required of all Literature Majors. See Department Website (www.english.ubc.ca) for options.

courses.name: CHEM 445B Projects in Experimental Chemistry - PROJCTS EXP CHEM
courses.description: Principles of experimental design, practice and problem solving in chemistry, including the opportunity to pursue projects in a research setting.
courses.prerequisites: CHEM 345. (or CHEM 335 and fourth-year standing in a Chemistry Combined Major specialization.)

courses.name: PCTH 300 Introduction to Pharmacology
courses.description: The concepts, language and techniques of scientific pharmacology. Intended primarily for Honours and Major students in Pharmacology.
courses.prerequisites: Either (a) all of BIOL 200, BIOL 201, CHEM 233, CHEM 235 or (b) all of BIOL 200, BIOL 201, CHEM 203, CHEM 204;  and CHEM 211 and one of CHEM 205, CHEM 201. (Permission of the undergraduate adviser is required.)

courses.name: EOSC 350 Environmental, Geotechnical, and Exploration Geophysics I
courses.description: Principles of geophysical survey design, data acquisition, processing and interpretation with emphasis on near-surface problems. Magnetic, seismic reflection/refraction, electromagnetic and ground penetrating radar surveys. Case history analysis of environmental and geotechnical problems.
courses.prerequisites: One of MATH 200, MATH 253. (and third-year standing or higher in Science or Applied Science.)

courses.name: ECED 585E Advanced Seminar on Research in Early Childhood Education - RES EARLY CHLDHD
LARC 505 Landscape Architecture Design Studio V
SPHA 556 Social Determinants of Health
courses.description: Health planning and delivery models based on population health frameworks.

courses.name: FNH 451 Nutrient Metabolism and Implications for Health
courses.description: Integration of nutrient and energy metabolism on a whole-body and individual tissue basis and the implication for health. Emphasis will be on regulation of nutrient metabolism.

courses.name: CPSC 317 Internet Computing
courses.description: Computer networking, basic communication protocols, network infrastructure and routing.  Common application-level protocols and principles associated with developing distributed applications.
courses.prerequisites: CPSC 213 and either (a) CPSC 221 or (b) all of CPSC 210, CPSC 260, EECE 320.

courses.name: CRWR 509B Advanced Writing of Fiction I - ADV WRT FICTN I
CPSC 314 Computer Graphics
courses.description: Human vision and colour; geometric transformations; algorithms for 2-D and 3-D graphics; hardware and system architectures; shading and lighting; animation. (Consult the Credit Exclusion list within the Faculty of Science section of the Calendar.)
courses.prerequisites: One of MATH 200, MATH 253 and one of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223 and either (a) CPSC 221 or (b) all of CPSC 260, EECE 320.

courses.name: MECH 459 Biomedical Design Project
courses.description: A capstone design program designed to give students experience in the design and development of practical biomedical devices. Projects are provided by local industry and engineering research laboratories. For students in the Biomedical Option only. Credit will be given for only one of: MECH 454, MECH 457, MECH 458, MECH 459, or APSC 496.
courses.prerequisites: MECH 328. (and fourth-year standing in the Biomedical Option.)

courses.name: FREN 223 French Language and Style II
courses.description: Grammar, vocabulary, composition, language in context. To be taken by all students intending to proceed to the Minor, Major or Honours program. Credit will not be granted for both FREN 223 and FREN 343.
courses.prerequisites: FREN 222. (Or assignment based on placement test.)

courses.name: COMM 387 Entrepreneurial Finance
courses.description: Financial issues encountered by those active on the investing side of entrepreneurship, such as working for banks, venture capital firms, or corporate venture organizations, or anyone interacting with entrepreneurs and private equity investors.

courses.name: APBI 426 Plant-Microbe Interactions
courses.description: Biology and physiology of selected plant-microbe relationships. Impacts of plant-microbe relationships on society.

courses.name: CEEN 523 Energy and the Environment
courses.description: Energy/environment/society interactions; development of energy resources; energy demand and its determinants; policy dimension of energy and climate change; impacts on ecosystems; life cycle analysis; impact assessment and other tools for quantitative and qualitative evaluation of alternative energy sources.

courses.name: COMM 486S Special Topics in Business - ADV SOCIAL MEDIA
COMM 487 Environmental Management
courses.description: Explores corporate environmental strategy by introducing economic principles underlying environmental policy, law, and technologies for pollution prevention and abatement, environmental management systems, ISO-14001, energy systems, eco-marketing, and life-cycle analysis.  Credit will be granted for only one of COMM 487 or COMM 597.

courses.name: EMBA 586A Directed Studies - DIRECTED STUDIES
courses.description: Restricted to Executive M.B.A. students.

courses.name: LAW 338D Japanese Law - JAPANESE LAW
courses.description: Constitutional foundation and protection of human rights under Japanese law.

courses.name: FREN 220 Introduction to Early French Literature and to Textual Analysis
courses.description: Students will familiarize themselves with techniques of literary analysis, as applied to representative works from the Middle Ages to the 17th century, including theatre, fiction, poetry and non-fiction prose. To be taken by all students intending to proceed to the Minor, Major or Honours program.
courses.prerequisites: FREN 123. (or assignment based on placement test.)

courses.name: RELG 201 Near Eastern and Biblical Mythology
courses.description: An introduction to Near Eastern mythology, including Mesopotamian myths and the Biblical myths recorded in Genesis 1 to 11.

courses.name: ATSC 399 Co-operative Work Placement II
courses.description: Approved and supervised technical work experience in an industrial, university or government setting for a minimum of 14 weeks. Normally taken in the Summer Session (Terms 1 and 2) following third year. Technical report required. Restricted to students admitted to the Co-operative Education Program in Atmospheric Science.

courses.name: PHAR 454 Pediatric and Geriatric Drug Therapy
courses.description: Drug therapy considerations in pediatric and geriatric patients.

courses.name: COMM 458 Fundamentals of Managerial Accounting
courses.description: Use of accounting data in decision making by businesses; financial statement analysis; cash flows; cost behaviour patterns; methods of accounting for costs. (For non-Commerce students only).

courses.name: LING 100 Introduction to Language and Linguistics
courses.description: Study of language as a universal and uniquely human cognitive system: What universals do all languages share and how do languages differ? An investigation of sound systems, word-building, grammatical principles, language change, dialect variation, language acquisition, neurolinguistics. Recommended but not required for an honours, major, or minor in linquistics or speech sciences.

courses.name: EOSC 534 Geological Engineering: Soils and Weak Rocks
courses.description: Consult the credit exclusion list in the Faculty of Science section of the Calendar.  http://www.calendar.ubc.ca/vancouver/index.cfm?tree=12,215,410,414#4978

courses.name: HIST 302 History of the Indigenous Peoples of North America
courses.description: Indigenous peoples from pre-contact to the present in Canada and the U.S.  Topics include colonial frontiers, disease, fur trade, government policies, environment, gender, religion, oral narratives, activism, urbanization, and identity.

courses.name: EDCP 560 Scholarship of Curriculum Practice in Higher Education
LLED 492A Supervised Study in Reading - SPR ST IN READ
ORPA 723 Orthopaedic Surgery
courses.description: The practical application of orthopaedics in the operating room with discussion of techniques of surgery, anatomy, pathology, pathophysiology and complications of diseases.

courses.name: ANTH 100A Introduction to Cultural Anthropology - INTRO CULT ANTH
courses.description: Basic concepts and methods of anthropology; culture and race; comparative study of social systems, religion, symbolism, art, and other institutions. Examples are drawn from a variety of cultures.

courses.name: CRWR 208 Introduction to Writing for Graphic Forms
courses.description: Techniques of and practice in creating, developing, and writing the graphic novel, manga, and other forms of illustrated writing. The ability to draw is not required. Manuscript submission is not required for admission.

courses.description: Quantitative approaches to practical aqueous geochemistry problems. Equilibrium thermodynamics, kinetics, complexation, oxidation reduction, cation exchange, sorption and partitioning of organics. Case Studies.
courses.prerequisites: Either (a) all of CHEM 111, CHEM 113 or (b) all of CHEM 121, CHEM 123 or (c) SCIE 001 or (d) CHEM 154.

courses.name: POLI 420B Advanced Topics in Comparative Politics - ADV TPCS CMP PLI
courses.description: Seminar in comparative analysis of politics in democratic systems. For specific content in a given year, consult the departmental website.
courses.prerequisites: Two of POLI 220, POLI 320, POLI 321, POLI 322, POLI 323, POLI 324, POLI 325, POLI 326, POLI 327, POLI 328, POLI 329, POLI 330, POLI 331, POLI 332, POLI 333, POLI 350, POLI 351.

courses.name: DENT 507 Topics in Dental Public Health II (Critical Literature Review)
LAW 438 Secured Transactions
courses.description: The law governing the creation, perfection and enforcement of security interests in personal property.

courses.name: LING 530A Linguistic Problems in a Special Area - PROB IN SPC AREA
MINE 544 Mining Environment Case Studies
courses.description: Regulatory requirements for mine-mill environmental protection in design, operation and closure. Studies of environmental impact statements and closure plans. Credit will be granted for only one of MINE 544 or MINE 574.

courses.name: MUSC 694A Music Performance (Major) - KEYBOARD INST'S
courses.description: Private instruction, vocal or instrumental.

courses.name: ENGL 348A Shakespeare and the Renaissance - SHAKESPEARE
courses.prerequisites: (3rd year standing and 6 credits of first-year English, or Arts One, or 6 credits of ASTU 100 from CAP or 3 credits of first-year English and 3 credits of ASTU 150)

courses.name: AFST 352A Perspectives in African Studies: A Social Science Approach - PRSPCTV: SOC SCI
courses.description: Major issues and theoretical approaches.

courses.name: SOCI 100A Introduction to Sociology - INTRO SOCIOLOGY
courses.description: Introduction to problems in the analysis of social structures and processes. Basic sociological concepts will be introduced and their application demonstrated in various areas of sociology. Credit will be granted for only one of (i) SOCI 100C (6) or (ii) SOCI 100A (3) and SOCI 100B (3).

courses.name: CPSC 501 Theory of Automata, Formal Languages and Computability
PLAN 519B Internships - INTERNSHIPS
courses.description: Guided hands-on experience of day-to-day planning in a workplace environment.

courses.name: ECED 438 Observation and Documentation in Early Childhood Settings
MICB 404 Topics in Molecular Bacterial Pathogenesis
courses.description: A lecture/discussion/library research course. Topics such as antibiotic resistance, pathogen genomics; host-pathogen interactions; evolution of pathogens; host responses to infection, invasive mechanisms, resistance mechanisms.
courses.prerequisites: MICB 302 and one of MICB 308, MICB 403, MICB 408.

courses.name: GRS 390 Global Issues in Cultural Context
courses.description: Students interact face-to-face and on-line as a community of learners to discuss global issues in agriculture, food, and natural resources in cultural context. Typically taken while studying abroad.

courses.name: MECH 445 Fuel Cell Systems
courses.description: Energy system architecture and electrochemical energy conversion: fuel cell thermodynamics and electrochemistry; Proton Exchange Membrane Fuel Cells (PMFCs) and Solid Oxide Fuel Cells (SOFCSs); hydrogen production, storage, and distribution. Credit cannot be obtained for both MECH 445 and MECH 545.

courses.name: EECE 571U Electrical Engineering Seminar and Special Problems - PHASE LOCK LOOPS
KIN 586 Coaching Effectiveness
courses.description: Analysis of athlete performance and appropriate design and application of coaching intervention and skill acquisition for athlete and coach development.

courses.name: SPPH 520 Control of Communicable Disease
courses.description: Epidemiology of viral, bacterial and parasitic infections with emphasis on the control of these infections in human populations. Immunization programs will be stressed.
courses.prerequisites: Either (a) all of HCEP 400, HCEP 502 or (b) all of SPPH 400, SPPH 502.

courses.name: EOSC 554B Theoretical Glaciology - THRTCL GLACIOCLG
courses.description: Lectures and seminars on theoretical aspects of glacier mechanics; flow, stress and temperature fields, sliding theory, flow instabilities.

courses.name: EDCP 561 Scholarship of Teaching and Learning in Higher Education
MECH 439 Biomechanics Research
courses.description: Seminar in Biomechanics research.

courses.name: LFS 350 Land, Food, and Community II
courses.description: Introduction to tools and skills required to assess the economic, ecological, social, and technological components of managed landscapes, agrifood systems and communities comprising the land, food, nutrition and health continuum.

courses.name: DENT 529 Prosthodontic Treatment Planning and Outcomes Seminars III
EDUC 490R Special Studies in Education - SPEC STUDIES ED
courses.description: Topics not covered in a course. A pilot course may be offered under this name for only one year and with permission of the Associate Dean (Teacher Education).

courses.name: PATH 535 Seminar
courses.description: Attendance required of all M.Sc. candidates in the Department.

courses.name: ECED 598B Field Experiences - FIELD EXPER 2
courses.description: For those in master's, doctoral, and diploma programs.

courses.name: PHAR 442 Pharmacology IV
courses.description: The pharmacology of selected drug classes.

courses.name: PSYC 591 Survey of Social Psychology II
MUSC 162C Wind and Percussion Chamber Ensembles - WIND CHAM ENS SX
courses.description: May be repeated for credit in accordance with program requirements for B.Mus. or B.A. in Music. Open to other students by audition, with credit, as stipulated by their faculties.

courses.name: EPSE 589A Master's Internship in School Psychology - INTERN SCH PSYCH
courses.description: Pass/Fail.
courses.prerequisites: (Restricted to students in the School Psychology Master's Program.)

courses.name: LLED 462 School Library Resource Centre Programs

courses.description: Plato; Aristotle; selections from Hellenistic Philosophy. Recommended as preparation for PHIL 310 and PHIL 311.

courses.name: GRSJ 502 Issues in Gender, Sexuality, and Critical Race Theories

courses.description: Theoretical and empirical analysis of the atmospheric boundary layer with particular emphasis on energy and mass exchanges near the Earth's surface.

courses.name: EDCP 512A Education Action Research - EDUC ACT RESEAR
CHIL 599 Thesis for Master of Arts in Children's Literature
DENT 595 Endodontic Case Review and Treatment Planning II
courses.description: Student case presentations, treatment choice, and evaluation of prognosis.

courses.description: Private instruction, vocal or instrumental.

courses.name: ARST 556I Topics in Archival Automation - TPCS ARCH AUTMTN
SPPH 581I Selected Topics - MORBIDITY
courses.description: By seminar and directed readings, certain topics of current interest are explored in depth.

courses.name: BIOL 448A Directed Studies in Biology - DIRECTED STUDIES
courses.description: A course designed to allow students to undertake an investigation on a specific topic as agreed upon by the faculty member and the student. Permission of the supervisor required. No more than six credits of BIOL 448 may be taken with the same supervisor.

courses.name: ELEC 302 Electronic Circuits for Electromechanical Design
courses.description: Semiconductor fundamentals; modelling of electronic devices including diodes and transistors; design of power supplies, waveform generators and logic circuits; signals in time and frequency domains; operational amplifiers; active filters; oscillators; device specification and selection.
courses.prerequisites: One of EECE 251, ELEC 201, EECE 263, ELEC 203, MECH 221.

courses.name: AUDI 577 Advanced Studies in Acquired Speech and Swallowing Disorders
SOWK 440G Integrative Seminars in Social Work - INTGRTV SEM SOWK
courses.description: A series of seminars offered during the final term of studies which address salient issues in social policy and social work practice and draw upon combined knowledge from social work and related disciplines.

courses.name: ENGL 140 Challenging Language Myths
courses.description: Critical consideration of a broad range of commonly held beliefs about language and its relation to the brain and cognition, learning, society, change and evolution. Note: This is an elective course that does not fulfill writing requirements in any faculty or the literature requirement in the Faculty of Arts.

courses.name: CHEM 251 Physical Chemistry for Engineers
courses.description: States of matter, properties of gases, phase diagrams. Elementary chemical thermodynamics and kinetics. Reaction equilibria.
courses.prerequisites: One of CHEM 113, CHEM 123, CHEM 154, SCIE 001.

courses.name: ASIA 570B Approaches to Asian Literature - APPR TO ASIA LIT
ETEC 532 Technology in the Arts and the Humanities Classroom
LAW 261 Transnational Law
courses.description: Introduction to principles of public and private international law and research methods for international legal materials.

courses.name: THTR 499D Production III - PRODUCTION III
courses.description: Assigned projects in Theatre or Film design and production.
courses.corequisites: One of THTR 405, THTR 406, THTR 407, THTR 408, THTR 450, THTR 452, THTR 454, THTR 456, THTR 470.

courses.name: PSYC 360 Biopsychology
courses.description: The relationship between the nervous system and behaviour; the physiological basis of perception, motivation, learning, and memory. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: www.students.ubc.ca/calendar/index.cfm?tree=12,215,410,414.

courses.name: ECED 580C Problems in Early Childhood Education - PROB IN ECE
courses.description: Investigation and report of a problem.

courses.name: CLCH 399 Introduction to Classical Chinese II (Non-Heritage)
courses.description: Practice and expansion of the grammar skills learned in CLCH 389; reading of additional and longer passages from the classical canon. Credit will be granted for only one of CLCH 399 or ASIA 399.

courses.name: MTRL 378 Phase Transformations
courses.description: Solidification and solid state transformations; nucleation and growth processes; segregation and structure in castings; phase changes in steel; transformation diagrams; diffusion equations.

courses.name: FNIS 401M Special Topics - SPECIAL TOPICS
courses.description: Topics will vary from year to year. Consult the departmental website: http://fnsp.arts.ubc.ca.
courses.prerequisites: One of FNSP 200, FNIS 210, FNSP 210, FNIS 220, FNSP 220. (or third-year standing.)

courses.name: JAPN 211 Intermediate Japanese I B
courses.description: Continuation of JAPN 210.
courses.corequisites: (JAPN 210 and 211 are normally taken in the same year.)

courses.name: MINE 438 Advanced Process Mineralogy
courses.description: Textural parameters, such as mineral liberation size and mineral associations in connection with the mineral processing techniques for mineral recovery.

courses.name: MATH 606D Topics in Differential Equations - TPCS DIFRNTL EQU
BIOC 449B Honours Thesis - HONOURS THESIS
courses.description: A research problem under the direction of a faculty member. Restricted to Honours students.

courses.name: ASIA 346A Topics in Japanese Cultural History II: The Early Modern Age - TPCS JAPN CLT II
courses.description: Focuses each year on a specific topic related to the culture of early modern Japan.

courses.name: GEOG 350 Introduction to Urban Geography
courses.description: City systems and theories of urban location; internal spatial structure of the city; commercial and industrial location; social areas; neighbourhood and land use change; urban trends and public policy.
courses.prerequisites: One of GEOG 121, GEOG 122, URST 200. (or the former GEOG 260.)

courses.name: POLI 380 Quantitative Methods in Political Science
courses.description: An introduction to quantitative methods as utilized in the study of Political Science. Not available for credit in the Faculty of Commerce and Business Administration.

courses.name: MUSC 112 Class Brasses and Percussion
courses.description: Group instruction in music performance. Restricted to B.Mus. students.

courses.name: VISA 220 Drawing
courses.description: Development of skills in drawing including life drawing. Introduction to the development of personal style and concepts.
courses.prerequisites: A score of 72% or higher in VISA 110 and a score of 72% or higher in one of VISA 180, VISA 182 and a score of 72% or higher in VISA 183.

courses.name: FMST 442 Families and Work
courses.description: The effect of combining family and work roles.
courses.prerequisites: SOCI 200. (and at least one additional course in social science.)

courses.name: FREN 418J Studies in African and/or Caribbean Literatures of French Expression - AFRC/CARRIBN LIT
courses.description: An introduction to representative works. Topics include Negritude, the evolution of post-colonial literature, and the socio-historical context of each work.
courses.prerequisites: One of FREN 320, FREN 321, FREN 328, FREN 329, FREN 330.

courses.name: LAW 334 Introduction to Asian Legal Systems
courses.description: Introduction to the comparative study of legal systems of East and South-East Asia, including those of China and Japan.

courses.name: LAW 379C Externship - EXTERNSHIP
courses.description: Students work for an approved organization, supervised by a Faculty-approved mentor and a faculty member. Consult the Faculty for full eligibility criteria.
courses.prerequisites: Either (a) one of LAW  280, LAW  476 and either (a) LAW  240 or (b) all of LAW  359, LAW  260 or (c) all of LAW  400, LAW  270 or (d) LAW  469; ;  or (b) one of LAW  387, LAW  392 or (c) one of LAW  230, LAW  459. (Or other studies that provide adequate preparation for the program.)

courses.name: PATH 301 Basic and Physical Biochemistry for Medical Laboratory Scientists
courses.description: An integrated approach to specific areas of the theoretical and practical aspects of those physical and biological sciences relevant to medical laboratory science. Emphasis will be placed upon the application of basic science to those clinical disciplines practised by the medical laboratory scientist, e.g., histochemistry, clinical chemistry, microbiology, haematology, etc.

courses.name: PATH 547 Techniques in Molecular Biology and Experimental Pathology
courses.description: Nucleic acid purification and characterization; restriction enzyme digests; northern and southern blotting; cloning; DNA sequencing; polymerase chain reaction technology; electron microscopy; fluorescein-activated cell sorting.

courses.name: GEOB 407 Vegetation Dynamics: Disturbance, Climate and Human Impacts
courses.description: Investigation of vegetation dynamics integrating theory and research to address contemporary issues of global environmental change. Students will conduct fieldwork and learn to analyze data and interpret results.

courses.name: THTR 150 Introduction to Technical Production
courses.description: Foundation study of production technologies for the performing arts.

courses.name: MUSC 560A String Chamber Ensembles - STR CHAMB ENS
courses.description: Open only to graduate students.

courses.name: EOSC 535 Transport Processes in Porous Media
courses.description: Transport of mass and heat in groundwater flow systems; modelling techniques including an introduction to the finite-element method; modelling of groundwater contamination.

courses.name: DHYG 208 Oral Health Sciences II
courses.description: An introduction to desease-related concepts during the study of dental materials, general pathology, plaque biofilm, nutrition, radiology, periodontology, and oral pathology.

courses.name: MUSC 119 Introduction to Music Technology
courses.description: Practical and theoretical training in technologies that support current artistic and academic practice, such as MIDI, podcasts/videocasts, websites, social media, and software for score notation, music education, and basic audio/video editing.

courses.name: EPSE 311 Cultivating Supportive School and Classroom Environments
courses.description: Pass/Fail.

courses.name: FISH 510 Bayesian Decision Analysis for Fisheries Management
MUSC 512C Directed Individual Studies - INDIVDL STUDIES
courses.description: Approval by the Director, School of Music, is required.

courses.name: BUSI 401 Commercial Property Analysis
courses.description: Underlying theory and techniques used in the design and construction of commercial properties.

courses.name: EOSC 398 Co-operative Work Placement I
courses.description: Approved and supervised technical work experience in an industrial, university or government setting for a minimum of 14 weeks. Normally taken in the Summer Session (Terms 1 and 2) following second year. Technical report required. Restricted to students admitted to the Co-operative Education Option in Earth, Ocean and Atmospheric Sciences.

courses.name: BIOC 449A Honours Thesis - HONOURS THESIS
courses.description: A research problem under the direction of a faculty member. Restricted to Honours students.

courses.name: KIN 489T Seminar - SEMINAR
courses.description: Current topics and research in specific areas.
courses.prerequisites: (Fourth-year standing. Consult with Advisor for specific prerequisites.)

courses.name: ELEC 422 Biosignals and Systems
courses.description: Data acquisition, time and frequency domain analysis, analog and discrete filter design, sampling theory, time-dependent processing, linear prediction, random signals, biomedical system modeling, and stability analysis; introduction to nonlinear systems.
courses.prerequisites: One of EECE 331, ELEC 371 and one of EECE 360, ELEC 341 and one of EECE 269, ELEC 221, EECE 359 and one of CPSC 260, CPSC 259 and one of STAT 251, MATH 318, MATH 302, STAT 302.

courses.name: GERM 406A Selected Topics in German Literature - SEL TPC GERM LIT
courses.description: A study in depth of one topic of special interest, varying from year to year depending on interests of faculty and students. Possible topics: literature and film, the image of the outside world in German literature, individualism and conformism.

courses.name: GEOG 364 Globalization, Cities, and Regions
courses.description: Forms of economic development; changing location of economic activities and functions; implications for government and politics; local strategies for growth and equity.
courses.prerequisites: One of GEOG 121, GEOG 122. (GEOG 361 is recommended.)

courses.name: BMEG 554B Directed Studies in Biomedical Engineering - DR STD BIOMD ENG
EPSE 512 Critical Issues in Special Education
LLED 469 Resource-Based Teaching
courses.description: Principles and practices of teachers and teacher-librarians planning and teaching the curriculum using the resources of the school library resource centre.

courses.name: LATN 202 Second-Year Latin II
courses.description: Completion of the grammatical foundations of classical Latin, Part II, and an introduction to the reading of unadapted passages of Latin literature.

courses.name: EECE 571P Electrical Engineering Seminar and Special Problems - PRGM ANLY&OPTZTN
KIN 562 Bioenergetics of Physical Activity
courses.description: Basic energy systems of the human body; primarily concentrating on the bioenergetics of the skeletal muscle cell, recovery from muscular work, substrate utilization, muscle fiber types, strength, endurance and the physiological assessment of maximal performance.

courses.name: MTRL 564 Hydrometallurgical Reactor Design and Analysis
courses.description: Batch leaching kinetics, leaching mechanisms; statistical methods for design of multiparticle continuous leaching reactors; coupled heat and mass balances, mixing phenomena, redox and precipitation reactions, complex mineralogical feeds; heap and dump leaching.

courses.name: LLED 351 Literacy Practices and Assessment: Elementary
courses.description: Pass/Fail.

courses.name: ADHE 327 Teaching Adults
courses.description: Planning, conducting and evaluating instruction for adults.  Consideration is given to different beliefs and ways of thinking about teaching.

courses.name: PLAN 548D Current Issues in Planning - AFFORDBLE HOUSNG
courses.description: Each year the school may offer one or more courses on a topical issue covering recent advances in the field.

courses.name: LAW 566 Tax Policy
courses.description: The policies underlying the creation and implementation of tax laws. Credit will be granted for only one of LAW 411 or LAW 566

courses.name: CHBE 483 Energy Engineering
courses.description: Supply and use of conventional and alternative fuels and energy.  Design and operation of unit operations for processing of fossil fuels, biomass, and other energy sources.  Environmental considerations of energy use.

courses.name: ELEC 291 Electrical and Computer Engineering Design Studio
courses.description: Design projects involving electronic devices and circuits, electromagnetics, signals and systems, and microcomputers. Final group project requiring oral presentation of student-prepared slides.
courses.prerequisites: One of EECE 251, ELEC 201 and one of EECE 259, CPEN 211.

courses.name: COMM 486R Special Topics in Business - LDRSHP & GNL MGT
APSC 498A Directed Studies - OIL SANDS PROC
courses.description: Requires approval of a Department Head or Program Director.

courses.name: LING 313 Introduction to Linguistic Phonetics and Speech Science
courses.description: The articulatory and acoustic properties of speech production and perception, including practice in phonetic transcription, instrumental recording, and the analysis of normal speech.
courses.prerequisites: LING 200. (Recommended: All of LING 100,  PSYC 100 (or PSYC 101 and 102), PSYC 217 and 218, PHYS 341.)

courses.name: ISCI 360 Systems Approaches to Regional Sustainability
courses.description: Application of systems science encompassing geological, hydrological, ecological, atmospheric sciences, and energy systems approaches to study regional sustainability.
courses.prerequisites: (Third-year or higher standing in the Faculty of Science.)

courses.name: EOSC 270 Marine Ecosystems
courses.description: Introduction to diversity of marine habitats and ecosystems; hydrothermal vent, intertidal, coral reef, estuarine, deep sea, and polar ecosystems; impacts of ecosystem change; evolution of ocean plankton; invasive species; climate change; pollution.
courses.prerequisites: One of SCIE 001, CHEM 111, CHEM 121, CHEM 154.

courses.name: EOSC 373 Introductory Oceanography: Climate and Ecosystems
courses.description: Physical, chemical, and biological processes in the ocean and their interaction with climate and marine food-webs.

courses.name: FRST 539C Problems in Forest Sampling - PROB FRST SAMPLG
MATH 316 Elementary Differential Equations II
courses.description: Power series methods (ordinary and regular singular points, Bessel's equation); boundary value problems and separation of variables (Fourier series and other orthogonal series), applications to the vibrating string, heat flow, potentials. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: www.students.ubc.ca/calendar/index.cfm?tree=12,215,410,414.

courses.name: HIST 369 Europe, 1900-1950
courses.description: Europe in the first half of the twentieth century. Themes include the imperialist system, two world wars and their aftermaths, political and social movements of the interwar years, the Depression, and the crisis of liberal democracy. Credit will only be granted for one of HIST 369 or 462.

courses.name: PHAR 515 Nanomedicines
courses.description: Nano-sized drug delivery systems and their interactions with biological systems.

courses.name: LAW 470 Innocence Project
courses.description: Clinical program giving hands-on experience in reviewing claims of innocence post-conviction. Not offered every year; consult Faculty.

courses.name: KIN 471 Prevention of Sports Injuries II
courses.description: Training and safety strategies for the prevention of injuries or disorders of internal organs and central nervous system. Environmental and nutritional factors in conditioning and pre-event preparation.

courses.name: CPEN 491 Computer Engineering Capstone Design Project
courses.description: Design, analysis, and implementation of solutions in response to a real world computer engineering problem, provided by industry, research laboratories, or other suitable entities.  Includes coverage of topics such as project management.

courses.name: BIOL 438 Zoological Physics
courses.description: Animal systems viewed from a physicist's perspective. Topics include sensory systems, energy budgets, locomotion, internal flows, physical advantages of grouping.
courses.prerequisites: One of PHYS 101, PHYS 107, PHYS 117, PHYS 153, PHYS 157, SCIE 001. (BIOL 325 is recommended.)

courses.name: LAW 241 Torts
courses.description: A study of the bases of civil liability for intentionally and accidentally caused harms.

courses.name: CHEM 540D Seminar in Chemistry - ATMS AEROSOLS
courses.description: Compulsory for all graduate students in Chemistry. Pass/Fail.

courses.name: MUSC 512D Directed Individual Studies - ADV CHORAL COND
courses.description: Approval by the Director, School of Music, is required.

courses.name: BIOL 328 Introductory Parasitology
courses.description: Classification, morphology and life histories of animal parasites affecting humans and other animals.

courses.name: GEOB 472 Research in Cartography
courses.description: Use of cartography in primary research applications. Discussion of contemporary topics in cognitive, social, and technical cartography and data visualization.

courses.name: KIN 585 Performance Planning
courses.description: Application of findings from sport profile and gap analysis to the planning and design of high performance training and coaching programs. Focuses on quadrennial, annual, meso and microcycle planning to integrate key factors that impact athlete performance and progression along the athlete development pathway.

courses.name: BIOL 441 Animal Cell Biology
courses.description: Analysis of cellular organelles and the intracellular traffic between them, concentrating on mammalian cell systems.
courses.prerequisites: All of BIOL 335, BIOL 340, BIOL 341 and one of BIOL 361, BIOL 362 and one of BIOL 201, BIOC 202, BIOC 203.

courses.name: GBPR 501 Biomass Fractionation Chemistry
courses.description: Extraction of soluble compounds and macromolecules. Chemical and technical processes in production of pulp. Bleaching. Fiber production from woody and herbaceous biomass. Production of reactive intermediates.

courses.name: ASIA 101 Introduction to Modern Asia
courses.description: A survey of the emergence of modern Asia. Aims at an understanding of how the various peoples of Asia have maintained distinctive cultural identities despite centuries of political, economic, social and cultural change.

courses.name: SPPH 514 Decision Analysis in Health Care
courses.description: Methods and application of decision analysis to improve health from the perspective of the policy maker, health professional, and patient.
courses.prerequisites: Either (a) all of HCEP 400, HCEP 502 or (b) all of SPPH 400, SPPH 502.

courses.name: ASTU 201 Canada, Japan and the Pacific: Cultural Studies
courses.description: An interdisciplinary introduction to the cultures of Canada and Japan, and the interrelations between them. Specific topics vary from year to year but will include themes such as constructing the past; nationalism; self-perceptions; cross-cultural perceptions; multiculturalism in Canada and Japan; images in architecture, film and literature; mythologies.

courses.name: BIOL 121 Genetics, Evolution and Ecology
courses.description: Principles of storage and transmission of genetic variation; origin and evolution of species and their ecological interactions.

courses.name: PATH 447 Directed Studies
courses.description: An elective in clinical infection control, medical microbiology or molecular biology.

courses.name: ENGL 227 Prose Fiction
courses.description: Principles, methods and resources for reading the novel and the short story.
courses.prerequisites: Either (a) ARTS 001 or (b) two of ENGL 100, ENGL 110, ENGL 111, ENGL 112, ENGL 120, ENGL 121 or (c) ASTU 100 or (d) ASTU 150 and one of ENGL 110, ENGL 111, ENGL 120, ENGL 121;  or (e) WRDS 150 and one of ENGL 110, ENGL 111, ENGL 120, ENGL 121. (Or 6 credits of first-year English.)

courses.name: PATH 450 Systemic Pathology
courses.description: A series of Pathology discussions in conjunction with various clinical departments designed to illustrate the role of Pathology in the diagnosis and management of various diseases.

courses.name: HIST 259 Science, Medicine, and Technology in the Ancient and Medieval Worlds
courses.description: The history of science, medicine, and technology, emphasizing networks, exchanges, and encounters in a global context.

courses.name: LARC 431 Landscape Technologies I: Site Engineering
courses.description: Terrain design, drainage, and stormwater management. Open only to B. End. students. Credit will be given for only one of LARC 431, LARC 531.

courses.name: CONS 481 Conservation Planning and Wildland Recreation
courses.description: Theory and tools needed for the selection and design of protected areas, the designation of land use types, and the management and conservation of wildland recreation resources.

courses.name: EDST 505 First Nations and Educational Change
COHR 301 Business and Management Values
courses.description: Balancing organizational, personal, and community interests in a global economy. In addition to standard management textbooks and readings, the class will draw from the work of poets, fiction writers, essayists, and social critics.
courses.prerequisites: COMM 292 and one of COMM 203, COMM 392.

courses.name: STAT 536A Statistical Theory for the Design and Analysis of Clinical Studies - STAT THRY DSG&AN
MATH 308 Euclidean Geometry
courses.description: Classical plane geometry, solid geometry, spherical trigonometry, polyhedra, linear and affine transformations. Linear algebra proofs are used. It is suggested that MATH 307 be taken concurrently.
courses.prerequisites: One of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223 and one of MATH 220, MATH 226, CPSC 121.

courses.name: PSYC 449 Honours Seminar and Essay
courses.description: Students carry out a research project and report on its development during seminars. Students also discuss research by Departmental staff, with emphasis on choice of problems, research design and data analysis.

courses.name: PSYC 533A Current Issues in Clinical Psychology - CUR ISS CLIN PSY
MUSC 521C Seminar in Performance Practices - GUITAR PERF PRCT
courses.description: Studies in the theoretical and practical problems of musical interpretation.

courses.name: EOSC 548A Graduating Paper for Masters Candidates without Thesis - MSC MAJOR ESSAY
BIOL 456 Comparative and Molecular Endocrinology
courses.description: A comparative study of vertebrate and invertebrate endocrinology.

courses.name: COMM 444 Air Transportation
courses.description: An integrative treatment of air transport management including: demand analysis, sales and marketing, globalization trends, aircraft selection and fleet planning; airport economics and management.

courses.name: LAW 425D Cyberspace Law - CYBERSPACE LAW
courses.description: Legal issues arising from the development of the Internet and cyberspace.

courses.name: FRST 100 Sustainable Forests
courses.description: An overview of forests and forestry.  Survey of the disciplines, areas of study, and values that frame sustainable management of forests in BC and the world.  Assignments focus on critical thinking and written communication skills.

courses.name: MUSC 593F Music Performance (Major) - CHORAL CONDUCTNG
courses.description: Private instruction, vocal or instrumental. May be repeated for credit, in accordance with program requirements.

courses.name: ECON 562 Research Design and Policy Evaluation in Economics
LFS 100 Introduction to Land, Food and Community
courses.description: Orientation to the programs, learning environment and core values of the Faculty of Land and Food Systems; career programs; survey of professional opportunities and requirements.

courses.name: HIST 441 History of the Holocaust
courses.description: A study of the systematic attempt to destroy European Jewry during the Nazi regime, 1933-1945. Topics of special importance include: the motivations and behaviour of the perpetrators; the reactions of the victims; the roles of bystanders.

courses.name: THTR 306 Costume Design I
courses.description: Principles and practice of costume design for the performing arts.

courses.name: MIDW 110 Critical Appraisal of the Literature
RHSC 581A Writing to Enhance Practice - WRITE ENHANCE PR
APBI 342 Soil Biology
courses.description: The diversity of soil organisms (bacteria, protozoa, fungi, animals, plants) in natural and managed ecosystems; roles in primary production, nutrient cycling, decomposition and reclamation; interactions between soil organisms; responses to environmental change.

courses.name: MUSC 529 Introduction to Ethnomusicology
courses.description: Preliminary studies in the discipline of ethnomusicology, with an emphasis on history and orientations.

courses.name: CHBE 561 Particle Technology
courses.description: Topics vary from year to year and include gas, liquid, and particle mechanics, fine and nano particles; colloidal phenomena; packed beds; filtration; sedimentation; two- and three-phase fluidized beds; spouted beds; hydraulic and pneumatic transport; multiphase flows.

courses.name: PHYS 229 Intermediate Experimental Physics II
courses.description: Thermodynamics experiments, modern physics experiments and use of computers in data analysis.

courses.name: SOCI 303A Sociology of Migration - SOCI MIGRATION
courses.description: Sociological approaches to the movement of peoples and its impact over time.

courses.name: GEOB 204 Introduction to Biometeorology
courses.description: Basic principles and processes of climatology. Energy and water balance concepts. Weather systems and climate change, microclimate of soils, crops, forests, and animals. Credit will be granted for only one of GEOB 200, 204, APBI 244.

courses.name: CONS 210 Visualizing Climate Change
courses.description: Exploration of different future scenarios using visual media that provide an overview of the science of climate change, its implications and potential solutions, and better ways to communicate climate change.

courses.name: FRST 411 Complex Adaptive Systems, Global Change Science, and Ecology Sustainability
courses.description: Concepts of complex adaptive systems (CAS); exploration of how CAS can be used to manage natural and social environments for multiple goals under changing climatic and socio-economic conditions.

courses.name: SCIE 300 Communicating Science
courses.description: Effective communication and presentation skills in science.

courses.name: ISCI 448C Directed Studies - DIRECTED STUDIES
courses.description: Permission of the Director is required.

courses.name: RHSC 583D Applying Research to Practice - APPLY RSRCH PRAC
BAFI 511 Investment Theory and Asset Pricing
PHIL 432A Ethical Theory - ETHICAL THEORY
courses.description: Classic or contemporary works in ethical theory.
courses.prerequisites: (9 credits in philosophy at the 200-level or above; PHIL 230 is recommended.)

courses.name: ARST 600 Advanced Seminar in Research Methods
IAR 525 Practicum in Asia Pacific Policy Studies
ENGL 231 Introduction to Indigenous Literatures
courses.description: A study of cultural expression in contemporary indigenous contexts.
courses.prerequisites: Either (a) ARTS 001 or (b) two of ENGL 100, ENGL 110, ENGL 111, ENGL 112, ENGL 120, ENGL 121 or (c) ASTU 100 or (d) ASTU 150 and one of ENGL 110, ENGL 111, ENGL 120, ENGL 121;  or (e) WRDS 150 and one of ENGL 110, ENGL 111, ENGL 120, ENGL 121.

courses.name: ASTR 205 Stars and Stellar Populations
courses.description: Measurement of positions, motions, and distances in astronomy.  Temperature, masses, and spectra of stars.  Hertzsprung-Russell diagram.  Quantitative stellar structure and evolution.  Chemical composition of stars in different Galactic populations. Globular and open star clusters.
courses.prerequisites: ASTR 200 and one of PHYS 210, EOSC 211, CPSC 302, CPSC 303.

courses.name: HIST 102 World History from 1500 to the Twentieth Century
courses.description: The civilizations of Asia, Europe, Africa and the Americas, with emphasis on the political, economic, ecological and cultural links among them, and the impact of oceanic contact, imperialism, warfare, migration, and globalization.

courses.name: EDCP 320 Physical Education - Elementary: Curriculum and Pedagogy
courses.description: Pass/Fail.

courses.name: HIST 420D Topics in Canadian History - TPCS CAN HISTORY
courses.description: May include immigration, French-English relations, the growth of the state, health and welfare, or the family.

courses.name: LLED 381 Foundations of Teaching Modern Languages: Secondary
courses.description: Pass/Fail.

courses.name: ARBC 101 Introduction to the Grammar and Vocabulary of Classic Arabic
LAW 436 Restitution
courses.description: Unjust enrichment as the basis of civil liability. Not offered each year, consult Faculty.

courses.name: MUSC 105 Aural Skills I
courses.description: Sight singing; melodic and harmonic dictation; rhythm production; error detection; tuning; perception of harmony, form, and tonality; improvisation in set idioms. Restricted to B.Mus. Students.

courses.name: EDCP 530 Curriculum Innovations in Physical Education
courses.description: Developing an integrated approach toward curriculum planning and instruction by examining curriculum models. Rethinking the PE curriculum.

courses.name: COMM 380 Co-operative Work Placement I
courses.description: Approved and supervised work experience for a minimum of 3.5 months. Normally taken during the winter term of the third year. Technical report required. Restricted to students admitted to the Co-operative Education Program in Commerce. Option-specific prerequisites apply.

courses.name: BUSI 121 Foundations of Real Estate Mathematics
courses.description: Introduction to mathematics of real estate finance and statistical measures and methods and their application to practical real estate concepts.

courses.name: CRWR 570A Advanced Special Projects in Creative Writing - ADV PROJCTS CRWR
MECH 478 Internal Combustion Engines
courses.description: Analysis of spark and compression ignition engines. Calculation of fuel economy, power, and emission. Practical and regulatory considerations in engine design. Engine emission and control systems. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH 478 or MECH 578.

courses.name: CIVL 410 Foundation Engineering I
courses.description: An introduction to the process of foundation engineering. Empirical and analytical approaches used in current professional practice. Topics include site investigation, preloading, liquefaction assessment, ground improvement, design of shallow and deep foundations, and retaining structures. The importance of geology and technical communication are emphasized.

courses.name: ORPA 430 Orthopaedics
courses.description: Musculoskeletal pathology, including baseline levels of knowledge, skill and attitude, plus surgical exposure to orthopaedic injuries and management.

courses.name: CELL 510 Molecular Embryology
courses.description: Examination of the molecular interactions that underlie the later stages of embryological development.

courses.name: GPP 507 Environmental Law and Policy Frameworks
courses.description: Environmental law and policy creation, implementation, and enforcement at the international, national, and sub-national levels. Evolution of environmental law and policy, legal institutions, and major areas of law relating to ecological sustainability.

courses.name: BUSI 353 Intermediate Financial Accounting I
courses.description: An examination of accounting as a means of measurement and as an information system for external reporting purposes.

courses.name: ELEC 401 Analog CMOS Integrated Circuit Design
courses.description: Design and analysis of analog integrated circuits, with emphasis on CMOS design techniques. Gain stages, opamp design, frequency compensation, oscillators, A/D, D/A converters, PLL, DLL.
courses.prerequisites: One of EECE 356, ELEC 301, EECE 363, ELEC 302, EECE 374.

courses.name: CCST 502 Case Studies in Museum and Gallery Exhibitions
courses.description: A case study approach to analyzing museum and gallery exhibitions that are historically significant either because they raised issues and stimulated public debate, or because of radical features that proved influential on subsequent exhibitions. Course not offered every year.

courses.name: MECH 467 Computer Control of Mechatronics Systems
courses.description: Block diagrams and transfer functions, continuous and discrete domain transformations, feedback control system characteristics, control design in both continuous and discrete domain, absolute and relative stability, laboratory examples of Mechatronic systems design. Credit cannot be obtained for both MECH 466 and MECH 467.

courses.name: EOSC 550 Linear Inverse Theory
courses.description: Model construction, appraisal of nonuniqueness, and inference in linear problems. Tomographic inversions.

courses.name: MTRL 593B Directed Studies in Materials Engineering - DIR ST MATRL ENG
COMM 382 Economics of Entrepreneurship and Innovation
courses.description: Fundamental economic issues faced by entrepreneurs who want to commercialize innovations within start-ups and established firms.

courses.name: DENT 711 Clinical Periodontics and Implant Surgery I
courses.description: Pass/Fail.

courses.name: ENGL 312A Discourse and Society - DISCOURSE&SOCIET
courses.description: Introduction to theories of language and culture, and to techniques for analysing discourses in their social contexts.

courses.name: ASTU 310 Co-operative Work Placement I
